review: i was very curious about this product because it is recommended by amazon and on numerous sites as a hg tinted mineral sunscreen. the price is incredibly affordable and the formula is amazing. but it didnt work out for me when searching for a mineral face sunscreen here on amazon this product was always popping up. i did see more reviews on my dad the chemist and angies hot and flashy utube video which piqued my interest. the research done by the company to claim its high spf and ppd rating they used european standards to test which is better than us. all around sterling protection factor spf 50 and ppd of 19.2 that is more than pa. i need sunscreen to protect my skin from hyperpigmentation and dark spots as i am entering my 5th decade and unhappy with the consequence of tanning beds and sunbathing in my youth. i am waging war with uv rays and im determined to win.the product is priced from 1016 which makes it very affordable considering its a generous 3 oz tube. its available here on amazon as well as us drugstores. it is made in us despite the name australian gold.the formula is ultra matte and not sticky at all. it blurs fine lines and wrinkles with the tint coverage enough to smooth complexion but not too heavy when applied thickly as sunscreens require 14 teaspoon for face alone. it is light as a feather and super easy to spread. it appears darker out of the tube but it lightens up upon application. dries in reasonable time approx 15 or less mins which is better than some formulas which take ages to dry and sticky at best. the color is neutral as i have a neutral undertone and medium i am mac nc 30 in the summer in the winter i am mac nw 25 as i get golden yellow when i tanits a unicorn of a product matte not greasy no white cast at all and works as a primer and gives a finished lowmaintenance makeup free kind of look. everything you would want in a mineral sunscreen for those who care about absorption of nasty chemicals that is cosmetically elegant and has high sun protective qualities.why did this not work for me it makes me look paperydry even with a few drops of squalene oil and hyaluronic essence cosrx as others had advised if you are not oily complexion. my face looks great until i smile or raise my eyebrows as the depth of the lines are accentuated with emotion. crows feet at sides of eyes multiply and deepen. tis ages me 10 years. if i have a stoic face it looks beautiful but as soon as i smile or frown or make any expression its creepy.in addition it is very difficult to remove. i am used to natural formulas with beeswax and those are hard to get off but this one is up there with japanese milk formulas. youre going to need to double cleanse with an oil or balm first i use jojoba or virgin coconut oil and then a regular foaming cleanser or bar soap on some kind of cloth or scrubber i use makeup eraser cloth or a micro fiber cloth. its too much for my sensitivethinning  50 year old skin can handle. pulling and tugging i am raw from the experience.if you have oily skin younger and at the beach or in a situation where things slide off your face as soon as you sweat this is for you. outdoor activities exercising or running in the summer heat or a day at the beach or amusement park this is for you. as a daily sunscreen its a bit tenacious of a formula. great product but with caveats

review: i will start by saying that i am used to traditional nonmineral sunscreens and tend to only buy physicalmineralbased sunscreens when im going to be in a tropical ocean and need something reefsafe though more and more kids sunscreens are shifting to mineralbased. after quite a bit of research i settled on thinksport for my familys recent trip to hawaii and im very pleased with it. i brought and used three types of thinksport sunscreen thinksport kids lotion yelloworange and teal squeeze bottle thinksport adult lotion black white and orange squeeze bottle and thinksport adult spray black white and orange spray bottle. all protected us from sunburn and rubbed in to be invisible as long as skin was dry and free of visible hair visible whiteness persisted around my husbands facial stubble and chest hair.  the only difference between the kids lotion versus the adult lotion is scentthe kids version has a fruitier more tropical but nottoostrong scent possibly coconut and something else it was hard to identify that i found unobjectionable though one if my kids wasnt a fan and the adult lotion had a lighter less sweet more citrusy scent my son though maybe lime and mint but im not sure thats accurate that i love. the adult spray had no discernible scent so i suspect the kids spray might be fairly unscented as well. the easiest to apply by far was the sprayit sprays on white but feels very light rubs in easily and becomes invisible quickly. i was a little worried about whether it could possibly be effective given how light and thin it felt but it was  the lotions werent thick for a lotion but much thicker than the spray and went on easily but took more rubbing in to disappear than the spray this is consistent with my experience with lotion vs spray in traditional sunscreens as well. invisibility was harder to get after a second or third application or when skin was damp but allinall i found all three thinksport products to be superior to other mineralbased sunscreens i have tried in the past. in the future ill probably buy the adult thinksport spray for my kids and husband who all much prefer a sprayon sunscreen and the adult thinksport lotion for myself because i love the scent and dont mind rubbing it in. great reefsafe easytoapply sunscreen comparison of three thinksport products

review: i love intellishade. my dermatologist client sent me a sample of this very tube a year ago and what i love most is the combination of the fact that it is 45 spf not 10 or 15 spf which is the ridiculous but standard spf on most face moisturizers and it is tinted with just enough foundation tone that you do not need to apply foundation. protecting your skin from the sun is crucial and yet you dont have to give in to those greasy sunscreen lotions.so this is my second bottle even if the price is outside my comfort level i feel that it is entirely worth it. the product quality is very high and the ingredients are approved and endorsed by my dermatologist friend so i trust them. my skin loves this product. it is a wee bit oily and i have normal skin but it applies very nicely and gives your skin the silky smooth effect. i then add an organic mineral powder foundation and a little blush and im donelove love intellishade and happy to see that it is available on amazon its the best compromise between wearing enough sunscreen to protect your pretty face from sun damage and still looking great  fantastic product and worth every penny

review: ive been searching for weeks to find a tinted spf moisturizer that is safe to use for people that suffer from seborrheic dermatitis or any malassezia and this product is free from all ingredients that flare up the skin. yayi was a little uneasy about how expensive this product is for how tiny of a bottle you get. its even smaller than i thought it was going to be when i placed my order. however a little bit goes a long way. a small squeeze on my fingertip is enough to spread out over my skin.i will note that this is called a tinted spf moisturizer and while the product itself is a dark tan color when you rub it into your skin it basically dissolvesabsorbs into your skin and does not change your skin color. the print on the bottle itself says its a primer. so you would still need to use foundation or powder if youre trying to cover any blemishes because this product will not do that.overall i am very very satisfied with this product. i wore it while on a cruise and was in the sun for many hours and my face did not burn like usual. it has not given me any breakouts or skin flare ups. i wish it was a little more price friendly but you definitely are getting a high quality product for the price.

review: bought this for a trip to the yucatn and it exceeded my expectations. i used as directed and i did not burn. my skin is very dry and sensitive plus eczema and allergic to many ingredients in most cosmetics. i bought the untinted clear version a couple years ago and was happy with it. this tinted version smoothed out my patchy red and pale complexion nicely. some days i applied 10 min after an lrp hyaluronic moisturizer and other topicals another day after heavy moisturizing cream and a day without. it never rolled up on my skin even after reapplying after sweat sun saltwater pool water. it did irritate a little after i forgot to wash my face one night. but it washed off easily next day and after regular facial routine my skin returned to its normal quickly.its a little pricey but it is worth it to my very temperamental skin.btw its also quick and easy to applyif youre nervous about it working with your sensitive skin ask your dermatologist or elta for a couple single use samples.also the way the bottle dispenses helps prevent contamination and oxidation of the product just another bonus. i like it kindest to the most sensitive of skin

review: i picked this up based on a recommendation from drdray on youtube. i loved that she swatched all the colors and i thought medium deep would be the best one for me. thats what im wearing in the photo. black girlbrown girl approvedthis is now one of my favorite sunscreens i prefer tinted mineral formulas but sometimes its a challenge to find one with a shade that fits me and that is also watersweat resistant 80 minutes and also affordable. this one is perfect it checks all the boxes this doesnt burn my eyes or cause blurry vision doesnt irritate my oily skin. my sister has dry sensitive skin and also likes this. this has a skinlike finish. might be slightly shiny but thats normal to me. i like to use a fan to help it dry down more. consistency is very thinkind of runny and spreads easily. formula is comfortable and doesnt feel drying. reapplying is a breeze but have to be careful to not get it on clothes. i keep wipes in the car to wipe off my fingers. the coverage is very sheer not like colorscience flex which has more coverage and a much higher price but i also love. this doesnt cover imperfectionsdark marks but it does even out skin tone. some of my foundation colors in case it helps you with choosing a shade armani 7.8 eldw honey bronze kvd 063 mufe 3n42 haus labs 330 dior 4n nars aruba. i use tan in colorscience flex.the only thing i would change about this product is the packaging because it can get a little messy. i wish the opening of the tube was smaller more tapered. im still giving this 5 stars anyway. ive gotten this on my clothes white shirts but has not left any stains i always treat with oxi clean max force stain remover on the same day. washes out completely no staining no trace.i also picked up deep just in case but its too dark. my guess is that its best for people with skin tone mac nc45 and up. however drdray mentioned this is a good option for those who like to use self tanner and want the face to match the fake tan. i wouldnt use this on arms or legs because it will transfer to clothing or other fabric. also i realized the reason the deep shade was priced much lower is because it expires in august 2024 and i review: im typically opposed to sunscreen because of the stinging of eyes smell and white cast. im from hawaii so the smell of sunscreen typically reminds me of tourists but this sunscreen is not only reef friendly but smells pleasant almost like the smell of bio oil. it also has absolutely no white cast none. i was in so much shock its better than la roche or cerave. im an olive colored mixed blasian woman and the minute it hits your skin it just melts. for some it may seem like its greasy but its perfect for me it gives that korean glass skin look. there is also no piling i noticed with cerave sometimes it would pile or leave white clumps on the edge of my face this does not. i also do not experience any eye burning which is nice. the only reason you would experience this is if you applied it directly over your eye lids or near your eyes which they advise not to do. my only complaint is that it is not water proof so if you plan  on utilizing this during excessive sweating or any type of wet activities lol do not expect this to do its job. that is also stated in the product description.

    ive been using the neutrogena ultra sheer drytouch sunscreen spf 70 for a while now and its easily one of my favorite sunscreens heres why1. lightweight and nongreasy this sunscreen truly delivers on its promise of being lightweight. it absorbs quickly into the skin without leaving that heavy greasy feeling. perfect for everyday use especially under makeup.2. high spf protection with spf 70 it offers excellent protection from the sun making it a great choice for long days outdoors. ive used it during beach days and hikes and i never had any issues with sunburn.3. drytouch formula the drytouch technology keeps my skin feeling matte and smooth even in hot and humid conditions. it doesnt leave a white cast which is a huge plus for a highspf sunscreen.4. waterresistant this sunscreen holds up well during sweaty workouts or water activities. while its waterresistant i always make sure to reapply after swimming or intense exercise as recommended.5. no breakouts i have combination skin and im always cautious about products clogging my pores. thankfully this sunscreen hasnt caused any breakouts which is a relief.overall if youre looking for a powerful lightweight and nongreasy sunscreen neutrogena ultra sheer drytouch is a great option. it provides reliable protection without sacrificing comfort making it ideal for daily wear or outdoor adventures honest review of the ultra sheer dry touch spf 70

review: as a loyal fan of the eltamd brand i was excited to try their tinted sunscreen and for the most part it didnt disappoint.firstly i appreciate eltamds commitment to creating highquality skincare products and this sunscreen is no exception. the oilfree formula is fantastic for my combination skin providing sun protection without feeling heavy or greasy.the tinted formula is a nice touch offering a bit of coverage and helping to even out my skin tone. however i did find it to be a tad more sheer than i expected. while it provides a subtle tint its not quite enough to replace my usual foundation on days when i want more coverage.that being said the sunscreen itself is fantastic. the zinc oxide provides broadspectrum spf protection which is crucial for preventing sun damage and premature aging. plus its noncomedogenic so it wont clog pores or cause breakouts.overall while the tint was a bit sheer for my liking i still think the eltamd uv clear tinted face sunscreen is a solid choice for daily sun protection. if youre looking for a lightweight oilfree sunscreen that also provides a hint of coverage give this one a try. great but a little more sheer than i expected

review: i had to return the first order because when it arrived the product was leaking out the side of the lid below the pump and i couldnt get it to come up into the pump to come out where it is supposed to flow out. i sent it back and had them replace it but the second container wouldnt pump out at all. i thought it best to call the company to ask for assistance since i didnt want to return a second one and give up on the product. i was told by the person who works for the company to turn the tube upsidedown and tap it 8 or 10 times sharply against my other palm to get the product up into the pump applicator since it does not have anything inside to bring the product up into the pump and sometimes it just settles to the bottom of the tube. it was successful and now works just fine. i hope this helps others who might have this problem. i think the packaging should include this instruction printed on the outside of the box so others dont return a perfectly good tube of what is a bit expensive to waste. i really like this product but will admit that it is pricey. i have just started using it so i dont have much to go on yet. what i will say is that i have very sensitive skin prone to rosacea if i try new products so i was happy to find that this caused no irritation for me and i like the bit of tint that it has to even out my skin tone since i have never used foundation. so far i think its a great product. ill revisit this post if anything changes over the course of using the rest of the container.  6 weeks later i love this sunscreen no problems whatsoever i will be purchasing again. very nice product if your new product wont pump out read this

review: i could be married to this sunscreen for life but that is not going to happen until they fix the problematic packaging.i decided to try this out based on a recommendation from drdray because she recently made a video on the newly released deep tint version. i had never tried any elta md sunscreens before. but i had assumed this regular tinted version wouldnt work for my skin tone. but i soon found out the deep tint is actually too dark for me when i use the appropriate amount. turns out this regular tint is perfect for me and that doesnt happen very often. its lightweight spreads easily and blends flawlessly into my skin. i usually go for mineral formulas but id make an exception for this. it doesnt burn my eyes or cause blurry vision and doesnt irritate my oily skin. this has a skinlike finish. consistency is thin and spreads easily. formula is comfortable to wear actually moisturizing and doesnt feel drying. not greasy at all. reapplying is a breeze when the pump works because sometimes it doesnt. i keep wipes in the car to wipe off my fingers. the coverage is very sheer not like colorscience flex which has more coverage and a higher price but i also love. some of my foundation colors in case it helps you with choosing a shade armani 7.8 eldw honey bronze kvd 063 mufe 3n42 haus labs 330 dior 4n nars aruba. i use tan in colorscience flex.i noticed many other reviewers have the same complaints about the faulty pump. the pump worked fine on my deep tint bottle. but this one took about 100  pumps a prayer and an unwavering spirit to get the very first drop out. then it didnt work when i tried to reapply 2 hours later. its working again for now. but im concerned it will cause issues in the future. and this price tag is a lot to take a chance on it malfunctioning again in the future. i would not be happy if it breaks before im able to finish the bottle. im on the fence about exchanging it or returning it and waiting until the packaging changes.edit to add i decided to keep it because the formula is that good and i havent had any further issues with the bottle. id give it 100 stars but the packaging is problematic

review: update setting powder over this sunscreen is a great combo also keeps my oily skin nice and matte.i almost deducted a star because this sunscreen and its tint can rub off which i dont like. i didnt want something more like makeup than a moisturizer. i wanted a sunscreen that didnt leave my face so pale and was willing to try mineral instead of chemical to see which i like better. overall this sunscreen is great.price  it is pricey. there are less expensive ones out there but also much more expensive ones. i got this on sale so i was okay with what i paid.ingredients  i appreciate bliss being cruelty free and including several natural ingredients in their products. that goes for this product too.scent  not the traditional sunscreen smell just the lovely herbal scent of lavender. i have never used a sunscreen like thati think its great.skin type  i have combo oily skinnormal in the cheeks and oilyacneprone in the tzone. this did not make my face greasy or cause breakouts. it made my skin tone look very even and like i was wearing a very light coverage foundation. it left my face feeling soft. it does not leave a matte finish on its own but maybe setting powder applied on top could give that effect im also considering switching to a matte moisturizer so i look forward to seeing what that could do. of course your skin may be greasy after using this if you dont prep for it properly. for example i use things like a foaming cleanser and niacinamide serum to balance oiliness. overall i believe this sunscreen would be friendly to all skin types.durability  i dont think this product would hold up through intense exercise but that depends on how much you sweat and wipe your face as well as the air temperature where you live. i played sports moderate intensity while wearing this one day and it held up fine because nothing touched my face. i would not use a hat or sweat towel with it because the tint wipes off. that is to be expected with mineral sunscreen which is supposed to sit on top of the skin so keep that in mind.in conclusion  this sunscreen is a keeper. i would wear it for special occasions light to moderately active days and when i am not worried about it rubbing off on fabrics however  i will buy a more affordable durable and sheer sunscreen to have as well especially for game days  beach days  or really any day where i dont want my sunscreen sitting on top of my face.

review: loved the texture and as someone who is super sensitive so sensitive that i have had courses of prednisonesteriods to survive the rashes and reactions to things labeled sensitive skin et al this one refreshingly did not cause my skin to react but it unfortunately is too dark and orangey for very light skin like mine.also as one who is by profession very picky about color and accuracy literally this is what i teach and do as a professor teaching and in my work as a long time professional in the entertainment and creative industries they over compensated re color on this one. this one like some of the other new similar ones by these better manufacturers is too dark and incorrectly undertoned.for so long these manufacturers made these tinted mineral sunscreens way too light making it impossible to use for darker skin. now more than a few have begun to try and fix that but they now have overcompensated and ended up as well making the same mistake makeup manufacturers of the past made incorrect undertone. so as wonderful as this products texture and purity is the color is just not good enough for me and the undertone is too warm they failed to consider how the skin would look as the product sat on it for awhile and warmed up.warm undertoned skins may therefore end up looking orange after some hours wearing this and very light colored skin and those who are prone to redness may especially find themselves looking like they just spent a day in the sun.very disappointing as the texture is fabulous indeed and it truly is one that at least for me did not cauxe my skin to scream and complain i hope they really humble themselves and take some advice from truly expert colorists and makeup artists such as ms. brown nars and we who actually have mfas and ph.ds in such stuff. if the manufacturer is reading this i hope it truly reaches out and accepts help getting this color issue right. it is possible but you need to take advice from the color experts vs. just whoever thinks theyre the expert du jour. probably great for mediumdark color skin not for super pale folk

review: a wonderful product  i typically use a more moisturizing zinc sunscreen cotz during fallwinterspring due to the dryness those seasons produce in my area but for summer this stuff is great  applies like a thin water cream nearly invisible but i do have very palepink skin.  i can reapply easily if needed.  no burns yet so its 1010 for protection.  gave it 2 stars for moisturizing but thats since its not technically meant for moisturizing.  all i need is a thin zinc during the warmer and more humid months and this fits the bill.  price point is great  no fragrance or extra emulsifiers needed for my sensitive skin.  caveat  if you do have any dry skin it will show up and pill a bit.  to get the clearest looking coverage i recommend exfoliating chemically moisturize thoroughly wait 15 minutes to absorb that skincare goodness then apply.  stay safe out there  sunscreen is the best thing for all skin types and your older self will thank you later.

review: heres the thing it doesnt have multiple color options so if youre not the right shade youre stuck. i feel like thats a bit of a disservice when dealing with a product that is supposed to apply color to the face and match your skintone. like foundation or concealer if your going to put out a skintone focused product there should be enough range to cover many different skintones. theres one shade. thats it. and even on me a paler girl its a bit too yellow and i have to work with it for it to be unnoticeable. the color reminds me of back in the day when the only undertone to exist in affordable makeup was an unflattering yellow. the bane of my cool toned existence lol.however i dont even know if theres actually a tint like yes theres a color when i first apply but its like the pigment literally disappears after your rub it into your face. ive even wiped my hands on my dark grey sleep shirt after applying and it didnt leave color on my shirt why wouldnt it do that when its supposed to be a tinted product shouldnt it leave color behind if i wiped it off my hands and onto my shirt how can a product be invisible and tinted at the same timei mean if it was meant to go on tinted and then turn clear to match your skintone i feel like that kinda defeats the purpose of a tinted product. i dont understand how this product can effortlessly blend into all skintones with only one color.also it does have a sunscreen smell. personally i dont mind it but i know there are people who dont want a smell with their sunscreen or facial products in general.all the negatives aside if your the right shade and you dont mind the smell then its a nice tinted sunscreen and i feel like it does protect from the sun. theres just too many other variables  that make me not so happy with the product. if there was a better shade range and the tint actually stayed i might like it more. i have mixed feelings  explained

review: im still deciding how i feel about this product. i took forever deciding on a moisturizer as the one i usually use doesnt contain spf. i bought this when it didnt have any reviews on amazon yet but i did some research elsewhere and decided to give it a go.pros i like what this company stands for that the product contains minimal relatively ingredients is reef safe etc. it does provide a lovely lasting glow as advertised which is a plus for me because my skin tends to be slightly dry. it lasted longer than expected on my face without needing to reapply. i wore light makeup over it once and my makeup applied beautifully. finally i do love the look of the bottle. it is simple and chic.cons im not sure if all bottles are like this or if something happened to mine during shipping but the product is definitely a little separated. ive had to shake it vigorously to try to remix but that only slightly worked. it does smell like sunscreen at least to me. there is another lighter scent as well that is possibly supposed to mask it but i can smell the sunscreen on myself for at least an hour after applying. i hate the smell of sunscreen but ive yet to find a good spf that doesnt have it so not a deal breaker. this product did sting very slightly but i also typically find this with spf products. my skin is naturally clear but somewhat sensitive and breaks out easily. i didnt majorly break out from this product as i have from others but a couple of pimples did start to appear. ill continue to use the product to determine if this was the cause.overall i do recommend the product but i would be very interested in testing a bottle that wasnt so separated to see if it worked better for my skin good pros and cons

review: as you will read i had a good review on this product until yesterday when i noticed the expiration date. i purchased this 42424. the expiration date is 102024. i was shocked all the sunscreens ive purchased have at least a 2 year shelf life. this is unacceptable. i will not purchase this again. i do not recommend.paulas choice sunscreen is by far the best facial sunscreen ive purchased. the spf 50 truly protects my face for a good 3 hours in the sun. there is no scent to the sunscreen. this is not a thick sunscreen by any matters. this is very watery you have to be very careful when dispensing it from the tube because with a little squeeze a lot will come out. with that said a little goes a long way. for as much as i love this its not as moisturizing as i hoped it would be. my first use within 1 hour my skin became very dry. i dont suffer from dry skin. i have oily skin. i now use neutrogenas gel moisturizer before i apply the sunscreen  its perfect it absorbs fabulously. this doesnt leave a white cast  doesnt sting my eyes one bit which is hard to find in a sunscreen. this is costly for a small tube but i feel is worth the money i spent. i will definitely purchase again. i do recommend but know it may not moisturize your face enough. editgreat sunscreen but need additional moisturizer

review: i want to preface this review by stating that i have combination skin and have used my fair share of asian sunscreens skin1004 beauty of joseon nivea biore roundlab etc. a common theme among all of them is their lightweight feel. better put they dont feel like susncreens they just feel like nice lightweight moisturizers which is what i love about them. this feel is made possible because asian brands have a lot of freedom with sun filter formlations not possible in the us because of fda regulations. anyway it turns out that cosrx took the time to have this specific sunscreen fda approved which is why the list of ingredients resembles that of us sunscreens a whole lot. i only realized this after trying it on for the first time because contrary to the other reviews it is very greasy and heavy. now my definition of greasy and heavy is based on the time it takes to absorb into the skin and how it feels after. it will take a good minute to fully blend this into the skin and youll definitely feel it on your skin for a good hour after application. it will feel like a sunscreen. it reminded me a lot of la roche posay and banana boat sunscreens yes i consider those heavy and greasy. to be completely fair though i am a little spoiled by asian sunscreens so if youre used to how us sunscreens feel youll be fine with this. in summary dont buy this sunscreen if youre looking for a typical lightweight asian sunscreen. not your usual kbeauty sunscreen
clean_review: want preface review stating combination skin used fair share asian sunscreens skin1004 beauty joseon nivea biore roundlab etc . common theme among lightweight feel . better put dont feel like susncreens feel like nice lightweight moisturizers love . feel made possible asian brands lot freedom sun filter formlations not possible us fda regulations . anyway turns cosrx took time specific sunscreen fda approved list ingredients resembles us sunscreens whole lot . realized trying first time contrary reviews greasy heavy . definition greasy heavy based time takes absorb skin feels . take good minute fully blend skin youll definitely feel skin good hour application . feel like sunscreen . reminded lot la roche posay banana boat sunscreens yes consider heavy greasy . completely fair though little spoiled asian sunscreens youre used us sunscreens feel youll fine . summary dont buy sunscreen youre looking typical lightweight asian sunscreen . not usual kbeauty sunscreen

review: i bought this to replace my usual sunscreen because this was cheaper and i was hoping to find a more costeffective staple. ive used a variety of cosrx products including the good morning cleanser whitehead power liquid and pimples patches all of which are my goto staples so i had high hopes for this brand.all in all the sunscreen is just a little too thick and not moisturizing enough for my liking. i wear sunscreen every day under my makeup practically as a primer. if youre looking for a standalone sunscreen i think this is perfectly fine however for me it goes on like a thick mineral sunscreen it needs more time and effort to rub in and it doesnt give a refreshing moisturizing feeling.the sunscreen wears perfectly fine though i didnt notice a change in how my makeup wore with this which is good i use a thinner skin tint and then bronzer blush and a loose powder on top. i have oily skin so my skin will get oily throughout the day no matter what i truly dont think this sunscreen contributes more towards it in any wayi also havent tried to burn my skin but. im assuming the spf is doing its job havent gotten burned yet if it wasnt obvious from this long review i use sunscreen as part of my skincare routine and not just on days where im baking in the sun if youre thinking about starting this is a good one just not my favorite nice but not my favorite

    ive been using the cosrx daily spf 50 vitamin e sunscreen for a bit over 6 months and its been pretty solid overall. since this is a chemical based sunscreen it gets absorbed pretty fast and doesnt leave any white casts. the finish is glowy and dewy which is great for dry skin but it might not be ideal for oily skin types.that being said one issue for me was that while it advertises that it provides a spf 50 broadspectrum for uvb protection it does not specify the pa rating for the uva protection which has typically been specified in other cosrx sunscreens. ive reached out about this a few months ago but havent heard back anything from them. also i experienced some irritations when i applied it near the eye area. so dont use this near the eye.other than that its a decent sunscreen but the lack of clear uva protection info is a bit of a letdown. solid sunscreen but lacks uva protection details

review: after a horrible allergic reaction to a chemical sunscreen also from neutrogena i made the switch to mineral sunscreens. as a darkerskinned asian woman its hard to find products that are yellow enough without being too orange. in winter the medium deep of this product on application is an exact match to my skin to the point i sometimes cant see if i missed a spot to blend in. it does get just slightly darker with dryingoxidation but not enough to be concerning. its decently moisturizing  i wear it only over a serum and eye cream. if anything its slightly greasy on me. it is quite runny which i like as far as being lightweight feeling on my face but agree with others that it makes for a mess  i store my tube cap up and i still feel like a lot of product gets lostwasted inside the cap. i like that its water resistant although i probably wouldnt wear it to the beach or pool bc spf 30 is a bit low but its definitely not rubproof ive blown my nose and seen product on the tissue but ive never really found a product thats noseblowing resistant. i would never apply a tinted product on my neck out of concern of getting it on my clothes and this is no exception. i have other tinted mineral sunscreens with higher spf so i mostly will use this during the winter and when i only have to go outside for short periods. ive seen people say this is expensive but the price on amazon is reasonable considering ulta is selling these at 27.99 which is more than twice the price of the most expensive shade on amazon 10 on amazon for medium deep right now but also dislike that different shades of skin products are always different prices on amazon  i always seem to be a pricier shade. as long as neutrogena continues to make this ill buy it as its a cheaper alternative to my other tinted mineral sunscreens for days when i dont need a higher spf and can deal with feeling slightly dewygreasy. decent skin tone match for me

review: this product has more pigment in it than most foundations ive used. ive got melasmahyperpigmentation that ive been battling for years so its very crucial that i cover my hyperpigmented spots at all times. same time the shade difference between my darker and lighter parts of my face make it really hard to find a good foundation. it either leaves my darker spots painted over in a lighter color or leaves the dreaded line at my jaw. so i have to use something with okay coverage and some dewiness in a color between my two contrasting skin shades.to do this id been using drmtlgy universal tint moisturizer which has spf 46 but the coverage was lacking and its expensive. this was the perfect solution. i start with aveeno maxglow hydrating serumprimer then after that soaks in i apply this. after a couple of minutes i go over my darker hyperpigmented spots with the drmtlgy which has a higher spf and softer glow. then some concealer under eyes and im good to go.caveat  the reason this may work so well for me is likely just luck in that the color sits between my dark and light spots and has a warm peachygolden undertone. i can see how this would not work for someone with darker or lighter skin or someone with a cool pink or neutral olive undertone. or for folks who want to wear additional makeupfoundation over it. lets be honest this is good makeup for certain people moreso than sunscreen

review: i have rosacea and i sometimes hate the summer months because of the constant battle between having adequate sun protection plus some kind of makeupcoverage to mask the underlying redness of my skin. over the years ive become more accepting of just foregoing makeup application so long as i can keep the rosacea under control which is the main reason i wear foundation anyways. i was hoping that this sunscreen would be a big game changer for me. in some ways it was the tint was perfect and did not appear too dark on my fair skin and also didnt make me look ghostlike. in fact upon first application i was in love  however as sweat began to accumulate on my skin after being outside in the heathumidity it was like the tint and sunscreen separated and it left my skin looking pasty and the sweat beaded up differently on my skin which made it all too noticeable. i also did not think about how the tint would come off on my towel when i dabbed my face off but i should have known that was going to happen anyways.  as far as the skin protection this sunscreen did its job and i did not burn even after sweating and wiping off most of the product without reapplying. but after i got out into the sun and humidity ie florida in july it left my face looking very strange almost as if i had applied a liquid foundation or something on my face that was about 23 shades too light for my skin tonelooking way worse than it had when i had first applied it that day. nice tint but doesnt blend well

review: i generally refuse to pay for fancyschmancy products hello fellow drugstore girlies and i resisted the hype. then i saw an independent test in which a line of photosensitive dots was placed on someones arm and each dot was covered with a different sunscreen. la rocheposays protection lasted so much longer than my usual drugstore choice so when amazon had it on sale for 29 i jumped. and darn it this is a fabulous product. it applies supersmoothly and is very lightweight but offers great coverage. it blends like a dream im over 40 and it doesnt settle in or exaggerate my pores. i use it instead of foundation in the summer when my makeup is minimal but you could definitely layer products over it without it pilling. i wish they offered a wider color range for people with darker skin i really hope thats in the works for the diverse world we live in. but for folks with mediumtoned or lighter skin its pretty flexible i had thought it would be too light and too grayishtoned for my olive skin fyi i have nearblack hair and browns dark brown eyes but it melts into my skin well and quickly. when this runs out though i still dont know if i can justify repurchasing unless i get another amazing deal ill probably just use e.l.f. which did ok if not as well in the testing and reapply frequently. sigh.
clean_review: generally refuse pay fancyschmancy products hello fellow drugstore girlies resisted hype . saw independent test line photosensitive dots placed someones arm dot covered different sunscreen . la rocheposays protection lasted much longer usual drugstore choice amazon sale 29 jumped . darn fabulous product . applies supersmoothly lightweight offers great coverage . blends like dream im 40 doesnt settle exaggerate pores . use instead foundation summer makeup minimal could definitely layer products without pilling . wish offered wider color range people darker skin really hope thats works diverse world live . folks mediumtoned lighter skin pretty flexible thought would light grayishtoned olive skin fyi nearblack hair browns dark brown eyes melts skin well quickly . runs though still dont know justify repurchasing unless get another amazing deal ill probably use e.l.f . ok not well testing reapply frequently . sigh .

    this product can be a little pricey but it was covered by my hsa so i got lucky i had been wanting to try a good quality tinted formula since i want to use little to no make up and im looking to simplify my morning routine while protecting my skin.enter la rocheposays anthelios. it is very lightweight and absorbs quickly into my skin.  you can also layer it and it goes well under makeup. there is no pilling. in my video i really couldve done with half or even less of the product i used but you can see it all gets absorbed and i used some on my neck as well. it might be a little darker but as you spread it and rub it it it blends beautifully giving you a natural tanned glow. it gives you a glowy look without being greasy. my skin tone looks even and with a healthy sunkissed glow. it also does not clog my pores. i love itthe sunscreen itself is the tinted mineral 50 spf broad spectrum. its a titanium dioxide sunscreen and has uvauvb and antioxidants. according to the label its water resistant for 40 minutes though i dont plan to use it for the beach or to use near water. but its nice to know i can sweat and be fine. my skin still looks great after the gym. ive recommended it to my sister and niece i can see why anthelios is a cult classic
clean_review: . product little pricey covered hsa got lucky wanting try good quality tinted formula since want use little no make im looking simplify morning routine protecting skin.enter la rocheposays anthelios . lightweight absorbs quickly skin . also layer goes well makeup . no pilling . video really couldve done half even less product used see gets absorbed used neck well . might little darker spread rub blends beautifully giving natural tanned glow . gives glowy look without greasy . skin tone looks even healthy sunkissed glow . also not clog pores . love itthe sunscreen tinted mineral 50 spf broad spectrum . titanium dioxide sunscreen uvauvb antioxidants . according label water resistant 40 minutes though dont plan use beach use near water . nice know sweat fine . skin still looks great gym . ive recommended sister niece see anthelios cult classic

review: i bought this tinted sunscreen for may when we head out for vacation. obviously i had to test it and make sure there wouldnt be an issue with the product as a whole. and there were no issues. i shook the product up and per the instructions. removed the cap and made a thin line on my forehead about 1.5 long. then 1 thin line under each eye and a thin line from my left cheek down to my chin and around to my right cheek. it sounds like a lot but the product is just barely thicker than water. i used my fingers lightly to start smearing the product around quickly covering my jaw and down my neck up to my temple area under my eyes my nose and everywhere it would be visible to others and also to make sure there were no uneven spots or product that got caught in hairs on the sideburn area. then i continued with my forehead and hairline. this product is very similar to another product i used that was made by a company that produces hair products that starts with a g. they stopped producing the tinted sunscreen and went to a cream paste which is greasy and sucks. this product is very thin dries like powder but needs a few minutes to settle in before it really matches your skin tone. im a mix between porcelain and ivory. a little red at times and sometimes look a little colorless. im anemic so my skin tone tends to be a little uneven and often very pale. no powder is required with this. you can use it as regular foundation and continue applying your makeup as usual but i found this product to be light as powder soft on the skin and not cakey. perfect really for light day wear and even ladies that are transitioning from their 30s into their 40s and beyond. i found that this product even allowed my natural rosy cheeks to stand out a little and didnt apply anything except a brown mascara to lightly tint my eyelashes and a lightly tinted chapstick. i was ready in less than 10 minutes. it was nice to have my old routine back. if you have blemishes this would not cover them. im going back to buy more. not only is it great for protecting our skin from the sun but it looks great as makeup.to note i have very sensitive skin. im even on medication for severe psoriasis and it can tend to make your skin sensitive to water temps. trust me it sucks i did not experience any burning rashes or have any issues concerning my skin. this product is very gentle.
clean_review: bought tinted sunscreen may head vacation . obviously test make sure wouldnt issue product whole . no issues . shook product per instructions . removed cap made thin line forehead 1.5 long . 1 thin line eye thin line left cheek chin around right cheek . sounds like lot product barely thicker water . used fingers lightly start smearing product around quickly covering jaw neck temple area eyes nose everywhere would visible others also make sure no uneven spots product got caught hairs sideburn area . continued forehead hairline . product similar another product used made company produces hair products starts g. stopped producing tinted sunscreen went cream paste greasy sucks . product thin dries like powder needs minutes settle really matches skin tone . im mix porcelain ivory . little red times sometimes look little colorless . im anemic skin tone tends little uneven often pale . no powder required . use regular foundation continue applying makeup usual found product light powder soft skin not cakey . perfect really light day wear even ladies transitioning 30s 40s beyond . found product even allowed natural rosy cheeks stand little didnt apply anything except brown mascara lightly tint eyelashes lightly tinted chapstick . ready less 10 minutes . nice old routine back . blemishes would not cover . im going back buy . not great protecting skin sun looks great makeup.to note sensitive skin . im even medication severe psoriasis tend make skin sensitive water temps . trust sucks not experience burning rashes issues concerning skin . product gentle .

review: im a dermatologist who likes to run sprints as an exercise. ive tested a bunch of sunscreens because so many burn my eyes when i run. my eyes are quite forgiving with this sunscreen. that being said i noticed a few other reviewers whose eyes have burned.  in my opinion they are probably just unlucky to be sensitive to this sunscreen. in short some people will have eyes that burn and some wont. this applies for all sunscreens. youve got to find one that you tolerate. the same rationale applies for rashes or acne.i recommend different sunscreens for different purposes. this one happens to be a little heavy for daily use but it does the job during exercise as well as any that ive tried. in case youre interested i apply it ridiculously thick about 45 minutes before i go out.  i look like a freak around the house but it gets absorbed by the time i step out the door. i recommend reapplying every two hours. for swimmers reapply every 30 minutes if possible because waterproof laboratory testing is done in a bathtub. its a lot different in the pool or the ocean.on the technical side helioplex refers to photostabilization which means that it resists breaking down when the sun hits it. yes you heard rightmany sunscreens break down in sunlightone more word of advice not related to this sunscreen so i can feel im honoring hippocrates and his oath  even the best sunscreens are not perfect in filtering or blocking ultraviolet light. so try to go out after 4 pm in the summer.  or if you prefer get out there at 6 am and be back home by 9 am.  if youre a hiker get a hat with wide rims from sun precautions or another company called sunday afternoons. they also sell shirts that block ultraviolet light and cool you off. i would post their websites but amazon doesnt allow links on these reviews.last thing like all dermatologists i get a bunch of sunscreens for free from manufacturers.  but i buy neutrogena sport face with my own money for my workouts on the track. dermatologist who runs loves this
clean_review: im dermatologist likes run sprints exercise . ive tested bunch sunscreens many burn eyes run . eyes quite forgiving sunscreen . said noticed reviewers whose eyes burned . opinion probably unlucky sensitive sunscreen . short people eyes burn wont . applies sunscreens . youve got find one tolerate . rationale applies rashes acne.i recommend different sunscreens different purposes . one happens little heavy daily use job exercise well ive tried . case youre interested apply ridiculously thick 45 minutes go . look like freak around house gets absorbed time step door . recommend reapplying every two hours . swimmers reapply every 30 minutes possible waterproof laboratory testing done bathtub . lot different pool ocean.on technical side helioplex refers photostabilization means resists breaking sun hits . yes heard rightmany sunscreens break sunlightone word advice not related sunscreen feel im honoring hippocrates oath even best sunscreens not perfect filtering blocking ultraviolet light . try go 4 pm summer . prefer get 6 back home 9 . youre hiker get hat wide rims sun precautions another company called sunday afternoons . also sell shirts block ultraviolet light cool . would post websites amazon doesnt allow links reviews.last thing like dermatologists get bunch sunscreens free manufacturers . buy neutrogena sport face money workouts track . dermatologist runs loves

review: this sunscreen worked well when we went to a clothing optional beach in 101f weather  neither my husband or i burned at all and i spent most of the time in the water my friend and her husband used a way more expensive brand and both burned.this stuff is thick. it sits on the skin even after being in the water and isnt super easy to get off. the second time i applied it i went back into the water and tried to kind of wash it off of my hands and it wouldnt come off at all so my hands had a visible thick layer on them the entire 2 hours i swam. i even used sand and rubbed my hands  nothing. i finally had to use a baby wipe and then wash with warm water and soap twice in an actual bathroom to get it off but since it was all over my skin it also got all over my husbands brand new car and isnt easy to clean off.we will definitely use it again because the protection was worth it but maybe use it a little more sparingly  i have a tendency to slather it on because i got so burnt last year i had blisters and needed rx burn meds and iv fluids to recover

review: the neutrogena sport face sunscreen spf 70 has been my goto companion for outdoor music festivals and it hasnt disappointed. heres why i love ithigh spf with spf 70 this sunscreen provides excellent protection against harmful uv rays allowing me to enjoy long hours outdoors without worrying about sunburn or skin damage.oilfree formula the oilfree formula feels lightweight and nongreasy on my skin making it comfortable to wear for extended periods. it doesnt clog pores or leave behind a sticky residue which is perfect for hot and sweaty festival days.facial sunscreen lotion the lotion texture makes it easy to apply evenly to my face ensuring comprehensive sun protection without feeling heavy or greasy. it absorbs quickly into the skin leaving behind a smooth and matte finish thats ideal for outdoor activities.waterresistant the waterresistant formula holds up well against sweat and moisture providing reliable protection even during intense dance sessions or outdoor games. i can enjoy the festival experience without constantly reapplying sunscreen.broadspectrum protection this sunscreen offers broadspectrum protection against both uva and uvb rays helping to prevent sunburn and premature aging caused by sun exposure. it gives me peace of mind knowing that my skin is wellprotected throughout the day.overall the neutrogena sport face sunscreen spf 70 is a musthave for anyone planning to spend time outdoors especially during music festivals or other events. its high spf oilfree formula and waterresistant properties make it a reliable choice for allday sun protection. i highly recommend it to fellow festivalgoers looking to keep their skin safe and healthy under the sun. sun protection for outdoor fun

review: i have both the ultra sheer dry touch spf 55 and the current product the clear face spf 50. they were about the same in appearance both are not shiny at moderate applications. i would consider both to be matte. the clear face did feel a bit more greasysmoother than the ultra sheer but it definitely still is nongreasy and nonoily. it just felt like the ultra sheer had more friction and was more powdery if that makes sense.i did notice that in very heavy applications the ultra sheer would pill more than the clear face and leave a little white cast. when i rubbed the spot with the ultra sheer it started to pill up significantly more than the clear face. however both still did great in not pilling up in general.  if i had to guess i would say that material used in the more powdery and matte feeling in the ultra sheer is the culprit of the increased pilling and whiteness. if you have darker skin or very tanned skin and like to apply a good amount of sunscreen for ease of mind i guess i would advise you to avoid the ultra sheer.the ultra sheer had a twist off cap and flat tip with a hole in the center. this means that it is easy to clean and get all the sunscreen off.with the clear face it has a pop off cap which is still attached allowing for easier one hand use. but this does mean that it is messier as you cant get all sunscreen out of the concave tip. sunscreen builds up on the tip cover as well which is annoying.both sunscreens will sting if they get into your eyes. both also initially leave a tiny bit of a white cast during application but disappear once you rub it in and give it a few minutes to dry down.if you have a costco membership costco has the ultra sheer dry touch 5oz   3 oz for 16 which is more value. i advise you to get that since the differences between the ultra sheer and clear face is negligible. but if i was forced to choose one i would choose the ultra sheer just because of the more cleaner cap.update after weeks of using both i did notice that in moderate applications sometimes the ultra sheer dry touch would sort of pill if i were to disturb the layer enough itching rubbing face. it would be slightly visible and look like white dried sunscreen. i didnt really have this problem with the clear face. i also noticed the ultra sheer dry touch dried out my face more compared to the clear face probably due the more powdery ingredients.update 2 i have then switched to koreanjapanese and abandoned all my us sunscreen including this neutragena one. the asian sunscreens dont sting my eyes are way more cosmetically pleasant i cant tell im wearing sunscreen less drying and some are quite reasonably priced on amazon. there are some out there on amazon or other websites with the sameslightly higher price per gram compared to this neutragena one. i use the skin aqua super moisture gel but the seller and product page is gone on amazon so just look around at various sunscreens and websites. comparing it to the ultra sheer dry touch pretty similar
clean_review: ultra sheer dry touch spf 55 current product clear face spf 50. appearance not shiny moderate applications . would consider matte . clear face feel bit greasysmoother ultra sheer definitely still nongreasy nonoily . felt like ultra sheer friction powdery makes sense.i notice heavy applications ultra sheer would pill clear face leave little white cast . rubbed spot ultra sheer started pill significantly clear face . however still great not pilling general . guess would say material used powdery matte feeling ultra sheer culprit increased pilling whiteness . darker skin tanned skin like apply good amount sunscreen ease mind guess would advise avoid ultra sheer.the ultra sheer twist cap flat tip hole center . means easy clean get sunscreen off.with clear face pop cap still attached allowing easier one hand use . mean messier cant get sunscreen concave tip . sunscreen builds tip cover well annoying.both sunscreens sting get eyes . also initially leave tiny bit white cast application disappear rub give minutes dry down.if costco membership costco ultra sheer dry touch 5oz 3 oz 16 value . advise get since differences ultra sheer clear face negligible . forced choose one would choose ultra sheer cleaner cap.update weeks using notice moderate applications sometimes ultra sheer dry touch would sort pill disturb layer enough itching rubbing face . would slightly visible look like white dried sunscreen . didnt really problem clear face . also noticed ultra sheer dry touch dried face compared clear face probably due powdery ingredients.update 2 switched koreanjapanese abandoned us sunscreen including neutragena one . asian sunscreens dont sting eyes way cosmetically pleasant cant tell im wearing sunscreen less drying quite reasonably priced amazon . amazon websites sameslightly higher price per gram compared neutragena one . use skin aqua super moisture gel seller product page gone amazon look around various sunscreens websites . comparing ultra sheer dry touch pretty similar

review: the environmental working group ewg gives this product a 410 so it is within my acceptable range for a 100 chemical sunscreen.  i have tried many sunscreens mineralbased chemical and others that use a combination.  im now leaning away from mineralbased sunscreens since i cant get used to the chalky white residue which makes you look strange and gets on your clothes and equipment.suncreens like this one from sun bum use chemical sun blockers so they generally are more userfriendly but are not considered as safe as mineralbased sunscreen.  if you or your children are in a vulnerable population then maybe you want to avoid chemical sunscreens in general.  the active ingredients in chemical sunscreens are designed to be absorbed through the skin to do their job but they can also get into your bloodstream and the rest of your body.  this product excludes the two ingredients which have the highest toxicity concerns oxybenzone and octinoxate.  so for me personally i consider it a fair tradeoff between usability and safety.in terms of sun protection my favorite is neutrogena sport face.  it works great but has some bad chemical ingredients and occasionally stings my eyes.  this product does not sting has less potentially harmful ingredients and is reeffriendly.  cons it does not offer the same level of protection spf 50 vs 70 for the neutrogena and does not last as long i do not like the watery consistency and the price at 4.33oz is a little higher than i would prefer to spend. decent chemical sunscreen with less toxicity concerns
clean_review: environmental working group ewg gives product 410 within acceptable range 100 chemical sunscreen . tried many sunscreens mineralbased chemical others use combination . im leaning away mineralbased sunscreens since cant get used chalky white residue makes look strange gets clothes equipment.suncreens like one sun bum use chemical sun blockers generally userfriendly not considered safe mineralbased sunscreen . children vulnerable population maybe want avoid chemical sunscreens general . active ingredients chemical sunscreens designed absorbed skin job also get bloodstream rest body . product excludes two ingredients highest toxicity concerns oxybenzone octinoxate . personally consider fair tradeoff usability safety.in terms sun protection favorite neutrogena sport face . works great bad chemical ingredients occasionally stings eyes . product not sting less potentially harmful ingredients reeffriendly . cons not offer level protection spf 50 vs 70 neutrogena not last long not like watery consistency price 4.33oz little higher would prefer spend . decent chemical sunscreen less toxicity concerns

review: background i ride a bicycle 1014000 miles per year and wear sunscreen every time i go out.  im usually in full sunlight from around 2pm until 6.  i have olive skin and i dont burn easily but i do burn and id rather not look like my skin is heavy leather.i like this product.  the only downside is that the feel takes a bit of time to get used to.  im no longer using neutrogena products because most of them oxybenzone andor retinyl palmitate which may be bad for you the research is inconclusive do your research.  products that avoid those chemicals including this one contain good ol zinc oxide which may have been the first sunscreen and for which there is a boatload of data over 60 years none of it bad.  the problem with zinc oxide is that it is grainy and usually dries solid white.  thinksport has done a very good job of making a zinc oxide based product that avoids the whitewash look of the old style zinc oxide brands.please note that even the fda which warns against excessive use of products containing certain chemicals has said that any sunscreen is better than none.  your choice is your choice.  my choice is this product.pros. zinc oxide is probably the best sunscreen ingredient in terms of long term safe use.conszinc oxide is less comfortable on the skin than the oxybenzone based productszinc oxide brands appear to be a bit less sweat and waterproof than the big brands neutrogena banana boat for example.  i feel like it needs to be reapplied according to the label directions while oxybenzonebased products pretty much coat you like shelac and dont come off at all until you scrub. its zinc oxide but without the chalky whiteness

review: update im no longer as thrilled with this product as i used to be. i find that it leaves a thick feeling on my skin and pills over dry patches easily. the texture is dry which is why i called it matte before but also oily at the same time. i dont know how to explain it other than feeling like a greasy powder. i know its an oxymoron. i suppose its like the sunscreens that claim to be dry touch sunscreens but their always still greasy.it does leave a sheen on my skin which goes away eventually but the texture of the product can still be felt hours later. it doesnt really absorb into the skin which it should since its a chemical not a physical sunscreen. works decently under makeup provided you use a good primer. ive been using the ordinary high adherence silicone primer.originalit is so hard to find a face sunscreen thats cruelty free and vegan. most cf  vegan sunscreens pride themselves on being natural and only containing physical sunscreens like titanium dioxide and non micro zinc. thats all well  good but if your skin is any darker than ghostly white the non micro zinc will leave a white cast. if youre not even a white person then forget about it.im so glad ive found a chemical sunscreen thats cf  vegan and doesnt cost 601 oz. its also very matte for a chemical sunscreen which i like. the bottle says moisturizing but i dont find it very hydrating which is not a problem for me since i have oily skin. if i had dry skin i would probably apply a light moisturizer before this sunscreen and i may need to do so in the winter.the product is very liquidy but not watery. easy to apply but there is a very slight chemicaly smell kinda like paint but only if you deeply inhale. once the sunscreen is applied and you wash your hands it will go away. this is not an issue for me.great product at a great price will definitely order again  again update meh. original finally affordable cruelty free  vegan chemical sunscreen for face
clean_review: update im no longer thrilled product used . find leaves thick feeling skin pills dry patches easily . texture dry called matte also oily time . dont know explain feeling like greasy powder . know oxymoron . suppose like sunscreens claim dry touch sunscreens always still greasy.it leave sheen skin goes away eventually texture product still felt hours later . doesnt really absorb skin since chemical not physical sunscreen . works decently makeup provided use good primer . ive using ordinary high adherence silicone primer.originalit hard find face sunscreen thats cruelty free vegan . cf vegan sunscreens pride natural containing physical sunscreens like titanium dioxide non micro zinc . thats well good skin darker ghostly white non micro zinc leave white cast . youre not even white person forget it.im glad ive found chemical sunscreen thats cf vegan doesnt cost 601 oz . also matte chemical sunscreen like . bottle says moisturizing dont find hydrating not problem since oily skin . dry skin would probably apply light moisturizer sunscreen may need winter.the product liquidy not watery . easy apply slight chemicaly smell kinda like paint deeply inhale . sunscreen applied wash hands go away . not issue me.great product great price definitely order update meh . original finally affordable cruelty free vegan chemical sunscreen face

review: wanted safe sunscreen for ages grandparents through toddlers. learned about chemically based versus mineral based sunscreens and latest info may 2022 published on thinksport sunscreen shows it to be the best overall so decided to give it a try. it is non nano zinc oxide read up on why that is important and mineral based which is what i have learned is safe for not only us but also the oceans and its in habitants that sunscreens often end up compromising. do your own research on why you want non nano ingredients and not nano in your sunscreen for health reasons and aging your skin reasons. for 5 adults and two young kids a 6 oz tube plus a third of another lasted the 10 days but do know we applied twice daily and used rash guards the other times if necessary. the tint based thinksport was perfect for our faces and left them dewy clear and not white would have used more of the regular untinted for faces if did not have the tinted option. if that is an issue for you get the tinted for your whole body but my research and our experience showed me thinksport leaves you less white than other non nano zinc oxide brands and we could not notice it much if at all after rubbing it in. these products worked extremely well for us researched well and scored big for our family with thinksport

review: i burn at the thought of a sunny day and especially since i went bald summer days are not a fun combo. i went specifically looking for a sunscreen that would work to keep my head less than strawberry red every day and stick around when i started to sweat and this is what i found. ive had it for the last two summers and ive been extremely impressed with how well it has worked.the negative of it is simply that its like putting on yogurt the stuff is thick but it works. ive found the most effective solution is to get small amounts rub it in my hands for a second then apply it. otherwise you spend 5 minutes trying to work it into your skin and you look like casper the ghost especially if it gets in your hair beard eyebrows arm hairs etc.this may just be a personal thing i sweat pretty dang easily too but once i put it on i do find my head sweats even more so i try to put on the sunscreen and stay in an air conditioned place for at least 10 minutes before going outside. if i go outside too soon it just sweats off immediately and then im sol. again thats probably more of a personal thing but something to keep in mind. once its on though it sticks around and keeps me protected through lawn mowing days at the beach or riding the bicycles.i just spent two days by the gulf of mexico in florida and was out in direct sunlight on the water both days. normally thats a recipe for aloe vera and pain for me but with thinksport i actually survived. i will never take that for granted. i searched for something to protect my bald head and this did it

review: i bought this sunscreen to go snorkeling in key largo. they told us we needed reef safe sunscreen and that this was a great one so i got it. i also loved that its non toxic unlike other sunscreens. i used it snorkeling without any issues i didnt burn at all and i continued to use this sunscreen for the remainder of my 3 day trip. over the course of those 3 days we went kayaking lots of walking around in the sun and we went on an airboat through the everglades so as you can imagine i had this sunscreen on every day all over my arms and legs and especially my face which i reapplied as needed. i didnt notice right away that there was an issue i just started to slowly notice that my skin was extremely dry. after a hot shower was the worst my skin was so dry and itchy i had to put on a ton of lotion and it never seemed like enough. i thought maybe it was the salt water and just being in the sun more than what i was used to. but by day 3 my skin was so bad and i was absolutely miserable. finally i realized it was the sunscreen. it was the only new product i put on my skin. everywhere i applied it was dry and itchy. my face was the worst of it it felt like sandpaper to the touch which its never felt like that in my life and it was inflamed. i shouldve known better than to try a new product on a vacation without seeing how it would react to my skin. but i dont have sensitive skin nor have i had any allergies to anything before. this is generally a very safe sunscreen from what ive read but i did see that sometimes people have an allergy to zinc. it took a whole week for my skin to heal from this. had to take colloidal oat baths and use lots of oils to finally get relief. i wont be using this sunscreen again unfortunately. im only giving some stars because it did the job and i didnt get sunburned despite all this. i would recommend testing this out on a small area of skin first before you put it all over just in case you have a reaction. caused severe dry skin  allergic reaction

review: i have been a longtime user of neutrogena sunscreen and picked this up to try it last year primarily to explore how effective it was given the issues surrounding active ingredients of nonmineral sunscreens.  it works well and has not failed me in any situation thus far.i try to properly use sunscreen i usually apply a bit before i go out in the sun at least a few minutes prior try not to rub it off with clothing or rubbing against stuff  people  etc and rarely reapply except on blistering sunny days in the summer or if i feel my skin beginning to burn in a cloudless 2hour midday sun type situation.  i apply enough to cover the skin though i try not to put on enough to make my skin whitish its a little tough given the mineral nature of this.  i dont mind a little whiteness on the skin it helps reinforce that youve got yourself covered.i have used this in the sun while swimming in a pool with no sun cover while at the beach at amusement parks on walks on full sun days etc.  in all scenarios it worked wonderfully.  i have not used it in situations where i sweat profusely all over only where id sweat on my torso under my clothes.i have validation that it works when i miss a spot by my watchband and that part burns.it definitely will leave white marks on black car interiors if you come in contact.  i am not sure if it leaves a yellow stain on white shirt collars like chemical sunscreen does but if it does it isnt nearly as bad as chemical sunscreen.i use a facespecific sunscreen for my face for now the sun bum face mineral sunscreen works nice  i ordered direct from them so no review here for it so cant comment on whether its good for face protection  eye irritation  etc. works well across multiple types of use

review: update march 12 2019 they changed the formula. i just opened a new tube and noticed that it glided on my face much better. the first ingredient is no longer shea butter but aloe vera gel. argan oil is also added as the third ingredient before shea which makes its more liquid. if any of you see the comment that says its hard to apply thats no longer true. i now can apply it on top of my vitamin c gel. they also add a bunch of antioxidant and plant extracts which help when youre exposed to the sun. at first im a bit worried that my sensitive skin may react to those extract but so far its all good.the differences between the old and new formula1. the new one is much easier to apply but also more oily. you will need a bit of powder on top.2. the new one is less chalky. thus its better for a darker skin tone. however the old one was a better primer if you have a light skin tone.3. the new one no longer contains green tea extract. it was replaced with calendula extract and a bunch of herbal extracts which makes the smell more herbal. this can be good or bad depends on how you like it. im fine with it.overall i prefer the old formula for its superior primer effect and more matt. however my skin seems to like them both equally.update on june 24 2018 this 3 oz tube lasts sooo long. i also like that its not separated into layers like some oil base sunscreen. the tube is not transparent so i cant see how much left. guessing from the weight i think theres still around 14 left after 5 months of daily use on the face. my skin has almost no acne now besides some hormonal monthly acne. will continue to use it for sure orginal review i have a dry yet sensitive and acneprone skin the worst combination ever since my favorite sunscreen was discontinued i have been on a quest to find a replacement for a year. this sunscreen is the first one that has everything im looking for. its moisturizing but has a matt finish. it acts like a primer and blurs my pore. i can easily put powder and concealer on top of it on the day i need to wear a makeup. on the day that i dont need a full coverage i mix in a bit of foundation to color it.the ingredients are full of antioxidant. the first 4 ingredients like zinc shea butter calendula and green tea extract are known acne fighters. i have been using it for just 10 days and the result has exceeded my expectation. not only my pores has gotten smaller but all my inflamed acne has disappeared this has never happened before except when i used 10 benzoyl peroxide which cause my skin redness and flaky so i had to stop using it. my skin now looks very healthy no more redness pimples or dryness.the consif you use vitamin c serum or any gellike moisturizer it tends to peel off when you put this sunscreen on top. i fix it by mixing a drop of argan oil with the serum. if youre not acneprone like me other kitchen oils like olive oil etc. should be fine as well.the reason for this long review is that i hope people will use it more so that babo will not discontinue it. i hope i wont have to search for a new sunscreen again. that was not fun cure my acne. moisturizing but not too oily. perfect

review: im happy to have found this sunscreen. most sunscreen products on the market these days contain hormonedisrupting chemicals that can be absorbed into the skin such as avobenzone which is unfortunately fdaapproved. titanium dioxide and zinc oxide cannot be absorbed into the skin nor are they hormone disrupters. if youre interested check out ewgs the trouble with ingredients in sunscreens for more information. after understanding how these chemicals impact human health i stopped using all my other sunscreen products including neutrogena which was definitely amazing under makeup.this bobo sunscreen is thick spreadable and only produces a faint white cast on the skin. before applying any makeup i squeeze a quartersize amount onto my hand spread it evenly across my face and let it set for 1015 minutes before applying any makeup foundation with a foundation brush. i also use loosesetting powder to tamp down the greasiness before applying any powdery products e.g. eye shadow blush etc. before leaving the house i also apply a healthy amount on my neck arms back of my hands and any skin areas exposed to sunlight. its been working very well i dont have any skin reactions to it. its such a gem and a musthave for everyone who goes out to get sun all year round. ewg verified  costeffective  no white cast
clean_review: im happy found sunscreen . sunscreen products market days contain hormonedisrupting chemicals absorbed skin avobenzone unfortunately fdaapproved . titanium dioxide zinc oxide not absorbed skin nor hormone disrupters . youre interested check ewgs trouble ingredients sunscreens information . understanding chemicals impact human health stopped using sunscreen products including neutrogena definitely amazing makeup.this bobo sunscreen thick spreadable produces faint white cast skin . applying makeup squeeze quartersize amount onto hand spread evenly across face let set 1015 minutes applying makeup foundation foundation brush . also use loosesetting powder tamp greasiness applying powdery products e.g . eye shadow blush etc . leaving house also apply healthy amount neck arms back hands skin areas exposed sunlight . working well dont skin reactions . gem musthave everyone goes get sun year round . ewg verified costeffective no white cast
