review: ive used thinksport spf 50 for a few years for longexposure days with no complaints. last order was precovid and since i ordered this time from amazon directly and the picture matched what i had previously that i would get exactly that again. instead i received a differently packaged and differently named product orange tube instead of red labeled spf 50 instead of spf 50. however both tubes have identical bar codes. sometimes this kind of thing can be due to regional differences so i went to the companys indicated url which had itself changed to investigate. at this writing thinksport is using both kinds of packaging on their tubes but with both kinds having an accompanying text label spf 50 suggesting that spf 50 is interchangeable with spf 50 and the amazon page lists it as spf 50 as well.however after closer comparison it appears that there was a reformulation. other than slight changes in names and in order of sequence indicating changes of amount following are mutually exclusive different inactive ingredients i came up withold red tube version includes aloe barbadensis leaf juice extract raspberry seed oil cranberry seed oil sorbitan stearate coconut based hydrogenated castor oil ascorbic acid vitamin c glucose oxidase  lactoperoxidase.new orange tube version includes polyglycery4 isosterate sorbitan sesquioleate hexyl laurate caprylhydroxamic acid glyceryl caprylate.the old version had the aloe listed as the second ingredient after water so removing that is a fairly big change im guessing for cost reasons. as for the rest manufacturers of beauty and skin care products shuffle secondary ingredients like a deck of cards so i dont find those differences too concerning. the active ingredient is still labeled as zinc oxide however the label no longer says nonnano but nonnano is still on the website ingredient label lists. whether zinc particle size makes a big difference is something for your own research but i find it strange that its listed on the website but not the new tube.use warnings and directions are still the same. the old red tube claims no paba parabens phthalates bpa oxybenzone avobenzone petroleum dioxane or toxic chemicals as well as a line about being the first sunscreen to pass whole foods premium body care requirements. the new orange tube removes both those lines. both tubes claim no animal testing new orange tube adds vegan and reef friendly logos.tldr ill give the new version a shot and am provisionally rating at 4 stars based on past performance but its definitely a reformulation and thinksport and amazon should acknowledge that its a different product and in their text should use the new product label without the  to reflect that. comparison of thinksport spf 50 to thinksport spf 50
clean_review: ive used thinksport spf 50 years longexposure days no complaints . last order precovid since ordered time amazon directly picture matched previously would get exactly . instead received differently packaged differently named product orange tube instead red labeled spf 50 instead spf 50. however tubes identical bar codes . sometimes kind thing due regional differences went companys indicated url changed investigate . writing thinksport using kinds packaging tubes kinds accompanying text label spf 50 suggesting spf 50 interchangeable spf 50 amazon page lists spf 50 well.however closer comparison appears reformulation . slight changes names order sequence indicating changes amount following mutually exclusive different inactive ingredients came withold red tube version includes aloe barbadensis leaf juice extract raspberry seed oil cranberry seed oil sorbitan stearate coconut based hydrogenated castor oil ascorbic acid vitamin c glucose oxidase lactoperoxidase.new orange tube version includes polyglycery4 isosterate sorbitan sesquioleate hexyl laurate caprylhydroxamic acid glyceryl caprylate.the old version aloe listed second ingredient water removing fairly big change im guessing cost reasons . rest manufacturers beauty skin care products shuffle secondary ingredients like deck cards dont find differences concerning . active ingredient still labeled zinc oxide however label no longer says nonnano nonnano still website ingredient label lists . whether zinc particle size makes big difference something research find strange listed website not new tube.use warnings directions still . old red tube claims no paba parabens phthalates bpa oxybenzone avobenzone petroleum dioxane toxic chemicals well line first sunscreen pass whole foods premium body care requirements . new orange tube removes lines . tubes claim no animal testing new orange tube adds vegan reef friendly logos.tldr ill give new version shot provisionally rating 4 stars based past performance definitely reformulation thinksport amazon acknowledge different product text use new product label without reflect . comparison thinksport spf 50 thinksport spf 50

review: theres nothing wrong with this sunscreen. its sheer not greasy doesnt make my face white never makes me break out etc. i do wish the spf were a little higher but though i love hot sunny weather im not a sun bather so this will do.i found it very difficult to find a sunscreen i could use. i had picked out several which were considerably more expensive but to my dismay they all contained licorice root extract including neutrogena with an spf of 100. i will not put anything on any part of my body that contains licorice root. it is very bad for the heart. some months back i was using a foot cream to prevent fungal infections and i began having attacks of tachycardia which came totally out of the blue. very scary. the problem wasnt my heart. the problem was the licorice root in the foot cream. the day i stopped using it my heartbeat returned to normal. so any sunscreen with licorice root gets a pass from me. licorice root can cause the potassium levels in your blood to drop drastically leading to heart problems. it does help moisturize the skin but not that much and certainly not enough to warrant the risk. all manufacturers of any skin care products should remove it from their lines immediately.so i finally found this sunscreen and to my delight it contained no licorice root extract. its a nice sunscreen its lightweight and gives my skin a dewy look but as i said i do wish the spf were higher. other than that its just about perfect. highly recommended. its fine but wish the spf were higher
clean_review: theres nothing wrong sunscreen . sheer not greasy doesnt make face white never makes break etc . wish spf little higher though love hot sunny weather im not sun bather do.i found difficult find sunscreen could use . picked several considerably expensive dismay contained licorice root extract including neutrogena spf 100. not put anything part body contains licorice root . bad heart . months back using foot cream prevent fungal infections began attacks tachycardia came totally blue . scary . problem wasnt heart . problem licorice root foot cream . day stopped using heartbeat returned normal . sunscreen licorice root gets pass . licorice root cause potassium levels blood drop drastically leading heart problems . help moisturize skin not much certainly not enough warrant risk . manufacturers skin care products remove lines immediately.so finally found sunscreen delight contained no licorice root extract . nice sunscreen lightweight gives skin dewy look said wish spf higher . perfect . highly recommended . fine wish spf higher

review:
i like the product itself so long as i am not going into the ocean.  knocking two stars off for misleading marketing. hawaii enacted two separate bills one in 2018 and one in 2021 that banned certain ingredients in suntan lotion.  the 2018 bill 104 outlawed oxybenzone and octinoxate which are not in this product as what they advertise as being compliant to.what their marketing team does not mention is that it is not compliant to the second bill which was passed in 2021 and went into effect jan 1 2023. the second bill amended 104 to include avobenzone and octocrylene as banned in sunscreen.  both avobenzone and octocrylene are in this product  just look at the label.below is an excerpt from the billsection 342d21 hawaii revised statutes is amended to read as follows  




  












































  




  




    sale and distribution of sunscreen containing oxybenzone or octinoxate or both avobenzone or octocrylene prohibition.  a  beginning january 1 2021 it shall be unlawful to sell offer for sale or distribute for sale in the state any sunscreen that contains oxybenzone or octinoxate or both without a prescription issued by a licensed healthcare provider.b  beginning january 1 2023 it shall be unlawful to sell offer for sale or distribute for sale in the state any sunscreen that contains avobenzone or octocrylene without a prescription issued by a licensed healthcare provider. not compliant to hawaii rules effective jan 1 2023
clean_review: like product long not going ocean . knocking two stars misleading marketing . hawaii enacted two separate bills one 2018 one 2021 banned certain ingredients suntan lotion . 2018 bill 104 outlawed oxybenzone octinoxate not product advertise compliant to.what marketing team not mention not compliant second bill passed 2021 went effect jan 1 2023. second bill amended 104 include avobenzone octocrylene banned sunscreen . avobenzone octocrylene product look label.below excerpt billsection 342d21 hawaii revised statutes amended read follows sale distribution sunscreen containing oxybenzone octinoxate avobenzone octocrylene prohibition . beginning january 1 2021 shall unlawful sell offer sale distribute sale state sunscreen contains oxybenzone octinoxate without prescription issued licensed healthcare provider.b beginning january 1 2023 shall unlawful sell offer sale distribute sale state sunscreen contains avobenzone octocrylene without prescription issued licensed healthcare provider . not compliant hawaii rules effective jan 1 2023

review: short reviewits affordable and darkskin friendly a rich moisturizing lotion texture lightly fragranced with no white cast. if you have oily skin you dont even need to moisturize beforehand just skip straight to this sunscreen after cleansing. probably wouldnt be the same for people with dry skin. its at first tacky but it dries down to a smooth finish. though this does have a shine to it that leaves your skin with a healthy dewy glow if you have super oily skin like me do follow up with a powder. if not after a couple of hours youll go from glowy to a grease soaked donut.the story i was shocked that the bottle was tinythe size of my hand funny when ive been through this shock at least a hundred times when trying sunscreens from korean and japanese brands but rest assured it does do its job at least for me and is affordable.ive struggled with finding a decent sunscreen for a good year now. ive tried neutrogena clear face baaad breakout biore aqua rich breakout nieva uv super water gel breakout frudiva okay no breakouts but heavily scented thick lotion and left me super shiny hada labo beautiful lightweight texture but made me break outbasically the struggle was real. until i landed on australian gold tinted sunscreen. that stuff is magic keeps me matte and makes my skin look better but the darkest shade has a gray undertone so i have to follow it up with bronzer.this sunscreen is perfect for when i dont want to deal with the hassle of wearing my tinted sunscreen am going out to run a quick errand or when im staying indoors the entire day. the pump is super useful especially if you do the two finger method application method. it comes out a yellowish color but once you rub it in it easily disappears into the skin. at first it feels tacky almost as if youve applied a serum but within 13 minutes it dries down to a smooth finish. it does leave a shine but nothing that a sebum or setting powder cant handle for 45 hours. the big pointer is that so far no breakouts but ive been using this only for two days so ill update this if i see any changes in my skin.im super glad i found this affordable option i was looking at elta md heard it piles especially with makeup so i held back and la roche posay anthelios ultra light but luckily i decided to peak at the more affordable spectrum of sunscreen. as of now this sunscreen is a keeper. lets see how it stands after a week 3 in 1 deal moisturizer sunscreen and no white cast

review: i use mineral sunscreen everyday. most of the mineral sunscreen leave a white cast so im leaning towards tinted sunscreen now. this one is a very affordable option in this category tinted mineral sunscreen. ive dry sensitive skin which is acne prone too reason for leaning towards only mineral sunscreen. i have tried this many times in different environment.  and yes even the people with dry skin can make this work. my observation is make sure to moisturize the face well 10 minutes before applying this sunscreen. this kind of create a seal so if you have applied moisturizer way before this your skin will feel the tightness. also it gets more dry if im in ac vs outside. so for office days i have to apply something heavier underneath. this does not break me out which is a plus for me. this spread well and in 23 minutes become totally matte. it does not have much coverage on its own but works pretty well to give a smooth look to the skin. my skin is brown mac nc42 and this does not leave any whitecast on me though when ill run out of this i will try their bb cream in tan because that will match me probably a bit better. but if you have oily skin this is probably one of the best.

review: i am a skincare enthusiast so sunscreen is my best friend and i only use spf 50 or greater.  ive tried many almost every brand available in s3ph0ra sunscreens and this the best high spf ive come across for super oily skin.  i use a pea size amount for my face and neck.  one layer leaves a powdery finish zero white cast on my medium skin and stays put all day.  of course one layer of sunscreen is never enough for me.  i spend way too much time  money on skincare for the sun to reverse all my hard work.  with 23 layers it does start to feel claylike but does not look cakey. it might sound uncomfortable to walk around feeling like a light layer of clay is on your face but i take dry clay over oily french fry face any day.  for people who have normal to dry skin i think there may be better sunscreen options with a higher percent of minerals and various finishes. if you are a sunscreen nut like me and have normaldry skin you probably could double up and lay down a chemical sunscreen first then put this one on top as a physical mineral barrier.  for the oily and super oily skin people like me or those who love a matte look the options are pretty limited and this one is the best.  oil breaks down almost everything so its pretty amazing that this sunscreen stays put all day and works really well under make up.  its also waterproof.  will repurchase again. great for super oily skin

review: this sunscreen is amazing. no other way to say it. as a member of the yes im that pale club i love how its tinted and leaves no cast. i have both the newer light australian gold mineral sunscreen and this original one. they both have a cooler undertone and honestly lookfeel the same to me. how i wear it i have very dry skin so this routine might not work for oily skin i wet my face and apply regular ol cerave moisturizer cream shout out to dr. drays youtube channel wait for it to dry dab a little of the ordinarys marula oil under my eyes so the sunscreen doesnt sink into my wrinkles brush my teeth then use the australian gold all over my face. i found that i really need to rub it in along my hairline or else i get an orangey line. for extra protection i put baby sun bum or any whitecast mineral sunscreen all over my face first then swipe on some australian gold to help get rid of the white cast.i know many people have commented that this sunscreen works as a primer for them and i agree i dont wear foundation but sometimes ill throw on some blush or bronzer and ive never had a problem. i find it dries matte.highly highly recommend to all my pale goddesses out there love love love affordable mineral sunscreen

review: i bought this product because i wanted to switch to a mineral sunscreen but was worried about the white sunscreen being noticeable on my face. overall this sunscreen is great. no bad sunscreen smell and no issues with sun protection. i wear this even on days im not going to be outside much but ive tested it on some long days outdoors this summer and no sunburns yeti gave this 4 stars because this is not just product you can just throw on quick and go out the door. its very drying. i usually only moisture at night in the summer but i have to put moisturizer on before i use this product. if i dont my skin is uncomfortably dry all day. i also strongly recommend using a makeup sponge to apply this and use setting spray or powder afterwards. this leaves an orange tint if it isnt blended well and never sets on its own itll smear all over clothes. im fairly pale but as long as i take a minute to blend this in well the color is perfect. ive been wearing this to work instead of foundation lately im the summer heat and im happy with it.if it helps anyone i usually wear 112 natural ivory in maybelline fit me foundation and bought this sunscreen in the light shade. great if applied correctly

review: so i found about this sunscreen on a youtube review and had to try it. this was about 6 months ago and i have been using it every day since. i have really sensitive skin and this sunscreen is perfect for me doesnt burn my face breaks me out or irritates it spreads easily with the fingers the matte finish is nice and is way cheaper than other mineral tinted sunscreen but if you are going to buy it be aware of1. its not a good sunscreen for the beach or if you spend a lot of time in the sun the amount of minerals on it is too low and if you need to reapply it every 2 hours it layers horribly.  so you will end up with sunburns or a cakey face. if you plan to use it for every day little direct sun time it works.2. smell awful like paint. if this bothers you skip.3. the color. i have fair skin and the color is ok but the undertone is really redorange so be aware if you have yellow undertones. if you have fair to light skin probably it will work on you but for darker skin tones im not so sure. i just wish it came in different tones.4. i agree with other reviews that it is difficult to take off. i usually take with off with a face wash aveeno for sensitive skin but i have to spend more time washing my face than with other sunscreens or products.5. it doesnt look pretty layered with makeup. so if you use foundation every day on top of sunscreen skip.6. it is a little drying. i usually put moisturizer before applying and after taking it off and is ok but if you have really dry skin maybe it is not for you. also it clings to dry patches a little.overall it is still my favorite for the price point  but its not the best sunscreen ever.

review: so. i really wanted to like this sunscreen but.ive been looking for a great all mineral sunscreen ever since i had a severe allergic reaction to a chemical sunscreen from a very insta popular brand that people raved about. since then ive decided to go all mineral just to be safe. i read many reviews from different brands and sites and people seemed to really love this particular sunscreen and the fact that it did not leave a white casperesque mask on the face but was also not some odd shade of unflattering orange tint. this tint is a very light neutral tone  suitable for pale to light medium skin with a cooler undertone.so here are my personal thoughts after a few uses. my skin is normal to dry but can get somewhat oily in the t zone at times its moody that way. the sunscreen goes on very nicely and the tint disappears and leaves a smooth satiny feeling on the skin. great right well heres where things shift. after the product dries down it feels sort of like putty sitting on top of your skin. i used the recommended 14 teaspoon around to cover the face and neck area and was very aware of it the whole day  it just sat on the face like a mask. i also tried it with light daytime foundation on top with the result feeling like cake on top of putty. the foundation ended up looking dry and settled into any fines lines. perhaps a more dewy moisture rich foundation would work better. ill have to play around with it.in conclusion the positives are. you do get a lot of product for a decent price and the tint is a good shade. ill keep using it for the summer probably on its own with no other products on top to run errands but this is not the greatest mineral sunscreen for me so ill keep looking elsewhere.

review: i am skeptical of all sunscreens and moisturizers because my skin is so sensitive. in the past i would use traditional sunscreen on my face which would sometimes sting and other times sweat or rub off near the nosepiece of my sunglasses. over the  years this has caused sun  damage which is very visible. i tried this australian gold botanical sunscreen because i love the other australian gold products and this one seemed to be what i was looking for based on reviews. it was everything i was looking for and more. first of all it goes on so smoothly and a little goes a long way. it feels like nothing on your face. it is not greasy at all and does not shine. the tint was just enough to blend my reddish areas into the rest of my face without looking like foundation. so i put it on and spent several hours in the sun fully expecting it to fail like other sunscreens on my face. i was so surprised because it did not rub or sweat off like other sunscreens and my face looked clean and freshnot made up. i was thrilled so i started experimenting with it as a primer and moisturizer every day. oh my gosh i love it so much . it is great under makeup but what i discovered was that i could put it on and use it as foundation for the summer months adding some eye makeup when i wanted to look a little less casual. i am so glad i found this product because i love it and plan to keep using it indefinitely. the best tinted sunscreenmoisturizerprimer allinone i have ever used

review: i love everything about this suncreen.with the light tint and matte finish when i wear it i get asked regularly if my skin is just that clear i have mostly oily skin light redness and enlarged pores. this sunscreen combats all of my current issues and makes me feel like a million bucks.i struggled with cystic acne throughout my early adulthood. its under control now but i do have pitted scars and some hyperpignentation left over. this sunscreen smooths out my skin and is the ideal solution for me to keep my skin looking even but natural. it stays on through the whole day with only a slight degradation in my tzone but ive found that reapplying a little bit solves any problems i have with that.it has a light color so obviously thats not ideal for darker skin types.  i found that as someone with medium olive toned skin though adding one small drop of a liquid color adjuster makes all the difference in keeping my face the same color as the rest of my body.  im not sure how well this would work for someone who doesnt have skin that is still in the light range but it does stretch this foundation to including more skin colors. since using this i have stopped using foundation completely. ive had friends with mature skin and others with dry skin try it and it works just as beautifully on them. i would recommend this to anyone hands down.

review: i have very fair sensitive skin with type 1 rosacea. extreme redness cant use chemical sunscreens fragrance is iffy for me too. other tinted mineral sunscreens i tried left a cast didnt have enough pigment to blur imperfections caked and flakes in my dry patches and settled into my fine lines around and under my eyes took a long time to dry down and usually still needed to be powdered over due to a wet face look and never reapplied well later in the day.now this. let me tell you. first smudge on my face i was impressed how it melted into my skin and blurred imperfections. spreads easily. did not settle in any of my fine lines. did not cake or flake on dry patches. no cast the tint was just enough to even my skin tone a bit and cover some of my pink cheeks. it dried down fast and almost matte. but not a dry powdery looking matte. almost like natural skin with the tiniest luster but no wet or oily or shiny look. no scent no irritation survived several hours in the heat cleaning out my car and garage sweating and in the sun. it still looked as good as it did from original application when i came inside. i was even able to reapply a new thin layer right across the top to freshen up. still no caking smearing or smudging on reapplication. its the holy grail and i already bought more finally the holy grail sunscreen

review: like many people i dont like greasier suntan lotions. i rarely swim and dont often lay out in the sun if im putting on suntan lotion its generally because im hiking walking working or maybe fishing. this means im moving quite a bit and wearing equipment or clothing and in both cases greasier lotions tend to make their presence known. as such i prefer something which isnt so oily.first i tried skin aqua a japanese suntan lotion. i mostly used the gold variety and found that to be pretty close to perfect you can hardly tell that you are wearing it after 10m or so. the nongold version is also pretty good but slightly oilier. however both did seem not to last quite as long as other suntan lotions ive tried even if they did well enough. they are pretty expensive so maybe i was being too conservative with the quantity of lotion used.sun bum is a great deal and i heard it wasnt too greasy so i decided to try it. it is true that its much better than most lotions ive tried with the exception of some sprayon varieties which are specifically marketed as being dry. it was also completely effective stopping me from getting any sorts of burns whatsoever. it has a strong but not overpowering traditional suntan lotion smell to it. it does burn if it gets into your eyes on account of heavy sweating but i think all lotions are like that.basically while id recommend trying skin aqua first this is strong second place. not as good as skin aqua but better than most

review: ive been using the sun bum original spf 50 sunscreen for a while now and i have mixed feelings about it. on the positive side its definitely a good sunscreen. it does its job well offering solid protection against sunburn and i havent experienced any skin issues using it. the lotion is easy to apply absorbs fairly quickly and doesnt leave a greasy residue which is a big plus for me.however there are a couple of downsides. first the price. i find it a bit on the expensive side compared to other options available. there are many other sunscreens out there that offer more quantity for a lower price. of course there are also some that cost more than sun bum but the price point is still a consideration for me. that said its worth noting that sun bum is vegan glutenfree and enriched with vitamin e. for people who need a glutenfree or vegan sunscreen or are looking for additional skin benefits from vitamin e this could justify the higher price. if youre paying extra you are getting these added benefits which you might not get from cheaper alternatives. even so i believe the price is kinda okay but it would be great if we could get a little more quantity.the second thing is the smell. this is where my feelings are really mixed. sometimes i enjoy the scent  it has a unique tropical aroma thats quite distinctive. other times im not as fond of it. i think this will really come down to personal preference some people might love it while others might find it a bit overwhelming.overall sun bum original is a reliable sunscreen that does what its supposed to do. if youre okay with the price and are curious about the scent its worth giving it a try. personally i might explore some other options next time just to see if i can find something more costeffective that i consistently enjoy. reliable protection with a few tradeoffs

review: this is a nice tinted mineral sunscreen. i have very sensitive skin that leans toward the dry side and rosacea so mineral sunscreens are recommended over chemical ones. it absorbs well into my skin and doesnt feel oily or drying. it pills a little bit probably because i was rubbing too much and my base moisturizer was a gel. fingers crossed with some practice the pilling will happen less.it blends really well in term of tint. i am asian with medium skin tone with olivepeach undertone and my husband is as white as the driven snow and somehow this sunscreen manages to be invisible on both of our faces. no white cast whatsoever. not completely matte but rather a healthy glow. not glossy or overly shiny at all but i dont have oily skin so i cant speak to that.this sunscreen has the best ewg score among all the drugstore sunscreen meaning it has lowest environmental and health impacts compared to other drugstore options. ive compared its score to cerave aveeno la roche pisay burts bees and cetaphil. cetaphil is the only other option that has a good score. i presume this eucerin is still nano zinc so if you want something completely reef safe you have to keep on searching. but if you want an affordable option thats available everywhere mineral no white cast non comedogenic then this sunscreen is as good as it gets. tinted mineral sunscreen that blends well to multiple skin tones and has good ewg rating

review: i was on the market for a tinted moisturizer that i could use daily instead of foundation but im allergic to a very common sunscreen ingredient so this was one of the few options i could safely wear.  i wasnt sure if it would meet my needs but figured at the very least id have a decent sunscreen. one tube has lasted me just over 6 months of almost daily wear and  i can report i am extremely happy with this product.the scent is vaguely warm and sweet but not stereotypically sunscreeny in any way. the texture is thick almost like a whipped lotion or cream and the product smooths on wonderfully as a result. after application it stays moist or maybe workable is a better word for a minute or two but feels like its completely absorbed once i massage it in a bit. absolutely no greasy feeling or shine the attached pictures are this product only with no powder. too often foundation leaves my skin looking dry and flaky while moisturizers make me look oily in their quest to give me a dewy glow. this product strikes the perfect balance between these two extremes for my skin.obviously i have a pretty fair complexion and the tint of this product works well for me. ive shared with with a friend with that tans more easily than i do and the coloring looking fine on her skin tone as well. better than i ever hoped

review: i ordered this because i recently had a very painful facial peel to remove sum damage spots so obviously i need a good sunscreen also i wanted something tinted so i could just slather on sunscreen if i didnt feel like wearing make up one day.spf 50 is a good level to prevent sunburn on faces. packaging says to reapply every 2 hours and its water resistant for 80 minutes.pros  hypoallergenic oxybenzone free fragrance free papa free phthalate free reef friendly no animal testing and dermatologist tested.  provides both uva and uvb protection.  the formula is not greasy and applies very much like moisturizer. bonusit does not smell like suntan lotion which i abhorein fact it is scentless so it will not compete with your cologne etc.cons  the tinted feature is a big fat zero although the lotion itself is tinted it does not tint your skin in the slightest. back to the drawing board on that one boys  the only other negatives are that the packaging does not include an expiration date a product lot number or the country of origin where the product was manufactured.  these are not unimportant shortcomings.overall i like the product but the tinted feature needs improvement. the good the bad and the not too ugly

review: i wanted a mineral facial sunscreen to use every day for the summer in place of makeup. its just way too hot and humid in fl to wear makeup in the summer. the mineral sunscreen i use for my body is fine for my body but it leaves a white cast and if i use it on my face i get break outs and irritation. this australian gold tinted facial sunscreen is perfect. ive been using it every day for a week. i apply it like tinted moisturizer just use more of it and will usually put translucent setting powder over it since everything tends to melt off in the florida heat. its been perfect for summer. i get a little bit of skin tone evening and way more spf than any actual makeup and it doesnt feel like im wearing anything at all. it stays put all day and doesnt melt or get shiny. ive also used it for 3 pool trips and its held up to 1.5 hours in the water. i dont think it would work as well anyone with a dark skin tone because the tint is pretty light but it would probably cut down on the white cast from the minerals. anyhow im pretty impressed to have found a good everyday mineral sunscreen that doesnt break me out and wont kill the coral reefs or break the bank. ive been recommending it to all my friends

review: i too bought this product because of hot  flashy.    i have pretty spectacular skin and barely wear any makeup.  my skin is not oily its not dry.  its healthy and dewy.  when i first applied this sunscreen oh i loooooved it.  but after it set it felt drying and as i put my very super light application of what i use for make up which is almost nothing for example to angie fro hf no offense lovely angie it didnt go so well.  i forewent my usual origins tinted moisturizer my foundation it has an spf of 40 and i just love it. but as i went to dab and i mean tiny minuscule touches of some concealer under my eye the combo made this weird paste.  and as i said my skin felt dry. almost itchy.  i love it so much though its great if i need to work out because it stays forever and it doesnt run.  but is hard to get off.  i use it on my arms and neck and hands and face when i need it like biking home from work that kind of activity level. ill be wearing it on the beach for sure under my hat and my sleeves lol.  it didnt work under makeup like i was hoping.  other than that its great.  good luck everybody great product but not for under makeup

review: i have tried dozens of mineral sunscreens and this one blows every other one out of the water. i am not exaggerating when i say this is the one beauty product i cannot live without. i am a beauty and skincare junkie i wear makeup everyday. this sunscreen goes on beautifully under makeup. even my husband likes to use it so much so that i finally got him wearing sunscreen daily.  the finish is matte there is a hint of tint and there is a bit of a blurring quality. im sure plenty of people would be happy to use this as there daily bb cream instead of a light foundation. just buy it. it is perfect in every way. there are great ingredients that make it moisturizing as well. i am very very fair and the lightest tint is perfect for me. the only reason i could see someone not liking it is if you dont like that silicone feel or if you are unable to find a good shade i hesitate to recommend this to my darker friends as im not sure how dark the darkest shade is. i wear this at the beach in the office and in the dead of winter it is perfect for all seasons and climates. try it

review: perfect for summer but i wear it all year long. goes on smoothly  blends very well with my under eye concealer i no longer use moisturizer except around my eyes as this is so moisturizing does not streak does not melt off by the end of the day. in fact  my skin has been t zone oily my whole life  and now i do not have the shines anymore i cant believe it i get many compliments on my complexion now  and thats also something ive never had before.    heres my routine i use a firming moisturizer around my eyes with spf. i apply australian gold evenly on my face  and apply a little extra for a 2nd coat where i might need a little extra coverage. it is somewhat transparent  so i then use under eye concealer under my eyes and where i want a little extra highlight.  i follow with translucent settings powder on my entire face.  if i need extra coverage i will use a mineral powder base and very very lightly dust it across my cheeks and forehead then down my nose  chin. the best part about this product is that you can adjust the coverage with just a few tweaks.  does not cause my face to break out does not have any kind of odor and the tube lasts a long time absolutely love this stuff

review: update i went without this sunscreen for 2 days and freaked out. it is now my first subscribesave products this tinted sunscreen makes my fairpinkish skin look blurred and matte. it holds up to sweating no problem. i wear it alone on very light makeup days and it just slightly evens out my skin tone and redness. dries down to nothing and works over all my moisturizers and under all my makeup no greasiness never breaks me out and doesnt sting skin or eyes. this is also the only sunscreen i can wear in a thick enough layer to actually protect from the constant california sun never going without my australian gold again 3i have been searching forever for a sunscreen that is slightly mattifying or at least not an instant oil slick on my face creamy going on and easy to rub in no white cast no eyestinging less than 15 reef safe and no fake coconutbanana smell. i tried to order two different asian sunscreens that were hg products for others but my order never arrived and i couldnt wait another month for a second order so i bought this one instead  and im happy i did this sunscreen ticks all my boxes. however if you have very dry skin or a dark skin tone ymmv. it is matte on me with my combonormal skin but i still had to wear moisturizer under it or it looked dry and showed a dry patch on my skin. it might be too drying for someone with very dry skin but i still think its worth trying it out. the tint is very light so it may show a white cast on darker skin tones. my hg affordable comfortable natural tintedblurring sunscreen for daily use 3

it was the sunscreen because i literally only burnt where i applied it. the rest of my face was red ending where i stopped applying this sunscreen a ring around my eyes where i put my eye cream  was fine. i had better protection from a nonspf eye cream than this. this product increased my sunburns  ive literally never had a sunscreen do that. i hope my skin will be okay.original reviewwhy i tried it i began using this because even tho i never burn but instead typically tan even without sunscreen i still want protection for my face. the laroch posay milk sunscreen with 100 spf i was using left my face feeling oily so i wanted to switch to this mineral based product. i used this for 1 whole week that was mostly gloomy and my first thoughts were that i love it. the tint has pink undertones which i wasnt crazy about on my beige complexion but i thought if i liked it enough ill buy again on their site and get a tanner tint it shows on amazon they have multiple tints available even though i only see this one i wish that was easier to find and buy for my dark skinned friends.the feel it has a matte finish which i liked for going on walks and hikes. i never felt sticky even when i was sweating. this feels dry and like my skin is actually my skin. because it sticks on so well i actually had a hard time taking it off at the end of the day with my facial cleanser so i knew and trusted the product stayed on my skin it repels water very well so i thought this stuff would be perfect for vacations it will never come off in the water at the beach or pool unfortunately it didnt protect well when i needed it to.sun protection for on the gloomy days i loved it and it stays on well but when it came time to shine literally on the first sunny day i got a sunburn on my face i never burn. ever. and was only burnt on my face where i applied this product and no where else on my body. because of this i cant give it good review since at the end of the day i need it to protect me from the sun and this had the opposite effectmy skin type i have dry skin that sometimes has reactions to sunscreens. i had no reaction to this one other than some light acne. i cant be sure if the acne was due to hormones or the product but i wanted to mention it since i did notice the difference.all this being said i did like the feel of this product and that its safe for reefs and mineral based because of that i will continue to try it out since i have so much product left. if i notice a difference and that im not getting burnt and that it was perhaps a oneoff situation i will of course review: i have hyperpigmentation on my forehead where i need to wear a high spf sunscreen daily. add to that i have sensitive skin prone to breakouts and allergic to fragrances. its been a challenge trying to find a good sunscreen that wouldnt cause breakouts effective and wouldnt leave me looking like a ghostwhen i first squeezed it out of the tube it came out a bit thick and thought this is going to be another one that will be hard to work into my skin. so glad i was wrong. it spreads so easily without any tugging or constant rubbing in. it actually has more of a primer feel than a thick sunscreen. i apply this on my face and top it off with bare mineral powder  it leaves my face with a nice matte finish that really lasts all day for me. no oily face no shine. the one thing i will say is that when you first see the color it looks like it will be dark on your skin. but it actually spreads on lighter on your face. i have olive skin tone so my face had a bit of a lighter tint to it so i do wish they offered a darker tint option. it protects my face pretty well but i do wear a hat to keep my forehead covered if im going to be out in the sun a long time to prevent any darkening of the hyperpigmentation spots.one thing to note since it does leave a matte finish this may not be the best for drier or mature skin. im in my late 40s but with light oily skin that works well with this sunscreen.this one is a keeper for me and really glad i found a product that didnt affect my sensitive allergic and acne prone skin

review: i bought this after reading about it in an article on sunscreens. i have rosacea seborrheic dermatitis and generally just very sensitive skin so i cant use 99.9 of facial products because they cause a reaction. i cant use any chemical sunscreens this is mineral which is a physical sunscreen and avoid all the usual junk like fragrance petroleum sls etc. i get tired of being shamed for not wearing sunscreen when i literally cant and then recently i noticed dark age spots developing which was depressing. i just avoid the sun as much as possible as my only option. so i decided to take a chance on this. im really glad i did im happy with the product and performance.i tried a couple methods of application and found i prefer using a silicone applicator the best. it doesnt get all over my hands and the product goes on smooth and evenly very easy and quick. the silicone applicator reduces wasted product also it lets me get a thin and even application. i accidentally tested how well it worked  i applied it to my face before a hot summer day of running errands but didnt think to put sunscreen on the rest of my body. later that night i realized the back of my neck and arms were pink from the sun but my face was totally fine. so obviously australian gold kept my face protected from the sun while the rest of me got a little too much uv oops. i also used it while tubing on a river all day with a large straw hat too and had no problems. im very pale and i got the tinted version it blends in nicely with the silicone applicator and i feel confident wearing it for both the look and the protection. good for rosacea use silicone applicator for best result

review: im hesitant when i buy any type of face lotion especially with sunscreen because i dont want the greasy feeling or for it to break my skin out.  i havent been using this lotion too long but so far im very happy with it.  its super light weight and easy to put on.  not much is needed to cover your whole face and i wouldnt over do it with the application.  i love that its a tinted lotion so it doesnt completely white out your face like sunscreen lotion can do.  its great to wear under makeup its smooth and not at all greasy so it almost acts as a primer for your face makeup i love that aspect of it.  its so important for us to wear sunscreen on our faces necks and ears so this is the perfect product for anyone not wanting to wear straight sunscreen on a daily basis.i do have pretty sensitive skin and live in a dry climate so i really do need very gentle yet effective products for my face.  there was one incident when my forehead got a tiny bit irritated after putting this on.  i cant blame this product for that though because it could have been another product or my skin might have just been extra dry that day and was upset when i did put a moisturizer on it.  so i would just warn people with really sensitive or dry skin to go easy with it at first and use a very little bit to see how your skin handles it i would still recommend buying it though.

review: i bought this lotion in an effort to rid myself of a stubborn and ugly rash around my mouth and nose  perioral dermatitis.  some comment i read from some blog suggested that zinc might help.  i chose this lotion for the simple safe ingredients.  i put it on in the evenings after washing my face with a dead sea soap adovia.  i put the lotion on fairly thick  its quite white and thick  and let the zinc do its thing while i slept.  it worked  its been keeping my rash down for a year now.  sometimes the rash flares up again from sunshine chlorine and a little of this lotion tames it right down.  i love it  i use it at night a few times a week and sometimes i use it in the morning as my sunscreen.  in that case i use less lotion and i just give it a few minutes to soak in  it does come on white but soaks in just fine.  i still wear a hat  perioral dermatitis flares easily in sunshine it seems.  i hope this helps anyone else dealing with this frustrating rash a huge help in conquering a rash  perioral dermatitis
clean_review: bought lotion effort rid stubborn ugly rash around mouth nose perioral dermatitis . comment read blog suggested zinc might help . chose lotion simple safe ingredients . put evenings washing face dead sea soap adovia . put lotion fairly thick quite white thick let zinc thing slept . worked keeping rash year . sometimes rash flares sunshine chlorine little lotion tames right . love use night times week sometimes use morning sunscreen . case use less lotion give minutes soak come white soaks fine . still wear hat perioral dermatitis flares easily sunshine seems . hope helps anyone else dealing frustrating rash huge help conquering rash perioral dermatitis

review: this really is one of the best natural suncreens ive used.  as some users have pointed out it doesnt slide on like regular sunscreen that you can glob on and rub all over your body from one place.  because it is a natural product nonchemical nonsynthetic the application is a bit different and you need to put a bit on the skin rub it into the surrounding area then put a bit on the skin in another place and rub into the surrounding area etc.  took me and my wifekids a bit of time to figure that out but once we did the product did fully disappear from the skin.  also because the consistency is thicker if you put too much on in one place you will definitely have more trouble rubbing it in.  yes a bit different than the standard chemical based sunscreens that absorb into the skin with all the potential health issues and not always the easiest to apply on a squirming child but given the nonchemical top ewg ranking nature of the product it really is a good tradeoff in my bookmy wife and i had really grown to love this brand and the other products  this sunscreen is just another product from babo that is really excellent. best natural sunscreen  a bit of a different applicaltion vs. regular sunscreens though

review: this stuff works i applied this sunscreen on my 9 year old son at like 900 in the morning. he played soccer and then spent the afternoon biking an unexpected 13 miles with a neighbor he got home late afternoon and had no sign of sunburn and i had never reapplied. my husband hates it because he cant figure out how to put it on without becoming super white but i seem to have a system for spreading it on that works fine. you end up a little whiter due to the nature of the stuff but not weird. i kind of rub the sunscreen gently into my hands to spread it out a bit pat the lotion all over the area im covering and then rub it in. it is very sticky so i wash my hands after applying. i have yet to test this out at the pool but i would be very surprised if it wasnt awesome since it only washes off of my hands with a good soapy washing. im going through the bottle pretty fast so if you have three kids like me it might get expensive. another natural sunscreen that i love is badger. same rules of application apply for me although the texture of the badger sunscreen is thicker out of the tube.

review: so my original review is below and i will leave that intact  4 stars. my new review is as followsthe reformulation of this product is awful awful awful can i write that more yes i will point out that babo added more cheaper filler ingredients and upped the price over the past few months hmm. besides changing the ingredients they now tout their product as glutenfree this is sunscreen youre not eating it kids i digress. anyway they also removed the extra from the sensitive skin note on the front of the tube and i can see why after today.after running out of my last tube i opened my new tube i ordered 2 through subscribe and save i didnt realize the ingredients list had changed its too late to return them now. the texture is certainly much easier to apply than the old formulation but since i cut the product with aloe another step but easypeasy it was something i could live with. the new texture was watery and runny you have to shake the tube quite a bit first before you use it something i hated about other natural sunscreens like avalon organics. at first i thought i had a bad batch. it smelled different too. once sufficiently shaken repeat often probably before youre done applying it to your face the texture isnt too bad but its definitely slipperier than the old formula and not necessarily in a good way. i guess if spreadability was a dealbreaker for you as it seems to have been for most users it might be more appealing now dont expect a miracle with zinc oxide not being white though.as soon as i applied the sunscreen my face stung and burned for 10 minutes my skin isnt dry fyi so that wasnt the cause. i had no idea why this was happening i wondered if i had a bad batch and then i compared the tubes. ingredients change. apparently the change in the formula is why they took that extra sensitive off the label. so if you do have more particular skin its not for you. whatever they did to it caused me to break out too. i also found it flakedpeeled off more easily than the old recipe even though it does blend more easily.so all in all. im done with babo. they used to have a decent product but since its not good any more im going to try to find a new sunscreen that doesnt irritate my delicate facial skin. i loved that the old version didnt irritate my skin or trigger breakouts and i could live with zinc oxide pallid clown makeup face i would take that over pilling burning and acne. i want a functional nonirritating nonnanoparticle zinc oxide sunscreen and babo no longer fits the bill which is a shame since they had a great zinc content.the rundownstinging and acne its not for extra sensitive skin anymorecheaper ingredients higher priceproduct is messier has consistency issues very runny without constant shakingproduct doesnt actually stay on your skin anymore but there are fewer issues with giant white smears.high zinc content still a plusold reveiwi like this product and i will continue to buy it. it might not be for everyone though.prosshort simple relatively safe ingredients good for sensitive skin pregnant women and people who are concerned about lots of additives.good ewg ratingno fragranceif youre the color of elmers glue or chalk it will blend right in with your skin tone without a problemzinc is pretty much the best sunscreen ingredient.consit is really thickgoes on really really white so you will need to blend it. i recommend doing a little bit at a time or mixing it with aloe vera gel to improve spreadability so you can blend it in. or you could mix it in with a little of your regular moisturizer just make sure you get good coverage and dont dilute the product too much. remember why youre wearing sunscreenfor people who tan or people with nonpaperwhite skin it will be really visible on your skin tone.if you get a little oily or sweaty it will rub off. make sure to reapply if you havent done so for several hours this goes for all sunscreens anyway old formulation was much better 4 stars this product is awful now

review: i like this sunscreen overall.  there is virtually no whitecast by the time you get it rubbed in.  for that reason alone this is a great option for the price.  for me it feels a little thick going on and not in a dewymoisturizing type of way.  it actually dries a little tacky in my opinion.  i have dry and sensitive skin so my skin can usually handle extra moisture but i dont like the tackiness that doesnt sink in or fade all day.  for that reason i think i will look for another sunscreen that will be better for everday wear probably means more  and save this one for wearing out on the boat or for lake days when i dont mind something a little more heavy duty.update 42821 ive been using this sunscreen daily now for 6 weeks as the last step in my skincare routine.  i ended up not looking for a different product in an effort to save money and not be wasteful.  this product has grown on me  my sister recommended that i try a translucentsetting powder over the sunscreen and that significantly helped with the tackiness.  for best results i personally recommend these steps for applying1 using clean hands rub a nickelsized amount of sunscreen between your hands.  really rub it around.2 gently patrub the sunscreen all over your face.3 repeat steps 1 and 2 with another nickelsized amount if desired i think derms are typically recommending using a quarter sized amount for best protection.4 wait at least 10 minutes i prefer 30 before applying powder to let the sunscreen soak in and dry down.  powdered foundation probably would work just as well as translucent powder though ive only tried the latter.when i follow these steps i find the tackiness to be much less of an issue and the white cast is virtually nonexistent at least for my fair skin.i still give this sunscreen 4 stars because although im liking it i probably will not repurchase after ive used it up. she good but she thicc not my favorite for everyday wear

review: i had been wanting to try this sunscreen for quite a while. i had seen a few youtubers recommend it and had also read some good reviews. the only reason i hadnt purchased before now is that i had wanted to use up some other sunscreens before i bought a new one. first lets list the bad thing about this the bad smell when you first put it on. not sure if i got a bad tube but it has that bad smell that i associate with fake tanning products that i have used in the past. i always hated that smell and this is no exception. the good thing is that i do not notice it after about 10 minutes. not sure if that is me just getting used to it or if it just disappears i am guessing the later.the good things about it is that it is tinted. i have skin that is fairwarm. a lot of my base foundation colors say light beige or buff beige.this color is not too ashy and doesnt make me look like a cast member of the living dead. im not sure how it would look on darker skin tones but for me it works great.the next thing is that it goes on like a dream really smooth and does not require a lot of rubbing or pulling on the skin. it blends really well. another bonus is that it has a nice finish. it has the look of a light bb or cc cream not total coverage like a base. it doesnt cover up my skin flaws but does blur them slightly but its a sunscreen so i wasnt expecting it to do that. it is more matte and not dewy or greasy which i like.lastly it does not pill or cause any other problems under makeup. overall i like it i just wish they would do something about that smell good product but initial smell isnt good

review: im reviewing for the spf 50 tinted facial sunscreen the one with the green leaves. i feel like the untinted body sunscreens are diluting the overall review rating for this product listing.amazon  please separate these productsthis tinted facial sunscreen is the first ever sunscreen that im actually happy to put on in the morning and dont need to force myself to do it just because i know i must.ive previously tried sunscreens from neutrogena la roche posay shiseido some korean brands and the only one i was able to somewhat stick with was the la roche posay tinted mineral sunscreen. that product has a rather dark tint feels slightly greasy and pills near my hairline when used under certain makeup but i was able to live with it for several years for lack of a better option.this australian gold tinted sunscreen applies exceptionally well and does not cause any pilling on top of all my skincare products and under my foundation i currently use the ordinary full coverage foundation.the tint isnt visible when you apply it on your skin and does not provide any coverage so dont worry that the tint is too light or too dark for your skin tone. the product is definitely not meant to be a tinted moisturizer or bbcc cream. the only reason for the tint is that it masks the white cast that mineral sunscreen normally gives off. theres a very faint scent to the product which shouldnt bother anyone.note this sunscreen contains a fair amount of silicone which makes it smooth slightly emollient and yet mattelooking. if you dont like silicone then this is probably not for you.lastly i will say that i bought this sunscreen at the same time as the new revlon full coverage founation the one thats supposed to replace the old whipped foundation but in my opinion is completely different. when i used the two together it was an absolute nightmare. the foundation applies patchy af and pills like theres no tomorrow. i gathered this is because that foundation also contains a lot of silicone and silicone products dont layer well together sunscreen perfection in a bottle

review: ive been trying to stick with a mineral sunscreen because many of the chemical sunscreens have active ingredients that are endocrine disruptors or harbor other risks. this includes many of the asian sunscreens like biores watery essence etc. people seem to rave about. i bought this tinted mineral sunscreen from australian gold not actually an australian company fyi they are based in indianapolis in and have been satisfied with it with some reservations.pros it has among the most benign ingredient list of any sunscreen ive found its free of problematic chemical sunscreens like oxybenzone or octinoxate free of paba is reef safe etc. in terms of wearability i like that it feels like i have nothing on my skin while im wearing it that it is a completely physical sunscreen and it seems to have protected my face while outdoors.cons the tint may not work for your skin. i have darker olive skin with a yellow undertone. the tint on this is more pale pink and when i first put it on it can leave a pale cast. that said it seems to blend in okay after a few minutes if i dont use too much. also this sunscreen contains silica which will tend to dry out your skin and will create an almost masklike layer on the surface of your skin. this is probably what helps the zinc and titanium the active ingredients in this form a protective layer but it renders the sunscreen not water soluble. that means you cant really wash it off with just water or a water based cleanser. i havent found this to be too bothersome but if youre bothered by buildup you may want to get an oilbased cleansercleansing oil to get this stuff completely off.overall i am satisfied with this sunscreen and will probably buy it again when it runs out. good mineral sunscreen but with some quirks.

review: i like using tinted sunscreen instead of foundation.  this one is not my favorite but only because i dont like the way it feels as much as i do some other brands.  even so the finish is nice it looks very natural.  its easy to spread on your skin and offers excellent protection from the sun. its a mineral sunscreen so it doesnt burn when you put it around your eyes.  ive never had any issues with skin sensitivity when i wear it no breakouts.i dont think it works well under foundation.when ive applied foundation over it the foundation seems to disturb the sunscreen layer and i get balled up goop.  though ive read other reviews that are of the opinion that it does work well under foundation so it could depend on your skin and the foundation you are using.  probably better to apply any other cream or liquid products over top of it with a sponge instead of rubbing in with your fingers so you dont disturb the sunscreen layer.  for me this product alone provides decent coverage and if i feel i need more coverage i just spot conceal with dermablend cream spf concealer.  eye makeup and blush or bronzer work fine over top of it.  a little sheer powder dusted over everything and im good to go.

review: this review is for the original universal tinted color so not the 3 new shades they came out with  although ive heard this original tint is equivalent to their new light shade.i initially heard about this sunscreen from the youtuber hot  flashy. i looked it up on amazon and wow the reviews are incredible so i had really high hopes unfortunately it didnt work out for me. ill explain why below but for reference i have sensitive skin that gets irritated if im not careful with products i started tretinoin a few months ago in march which is making my skin more sensitive dry to normal skin and im on the lighter end of medium skin tone with yellow undertones. i apply my sunscreens over my moisturizer and i reapply about every 3 hours since im indoors all day during quarantine. i do not wear any make up over my sunscreens.alright prosit is matte like actually really matte. so many mineral sunscreens claim to be matte but they end up looking oily and shiny on my face and never settle during the day. this one actually dried extremely fast did not transfer onto my hand if i touched my face and it was totally matte. it looked nice. this is tough to find and i was so impressed by the formula.its super cheap mineral sunscreens can be very expensiveit leaves no white castconsfragrance it claims to be fragrance free but that is an unregulated term. this product has eucalyptus leaf extract. this is pointless to put into this product  they could formulate it without this extract. but i get it. they want to keep up with the whole australian vibe even though this product is not actually australian. when i started my tret. journey i went super in depth into research about what is good for our skin and what is not. things like fragrance essential oils etc in face products can be extremely irritating for some skin types. and im one of those skin types. i initially was hesitant to buy this because of the eucalyptus extract. its in the middle of the ingredient list which means there is a pretty good amount of this in the product. i am pretty sure this is what caused my breakouts and irritation in addition to the thick formula see next two cons.breakoutsirritation by the middle of the day i noticed by face was feeling a bit heavy around the cheek area and my pores did not feel like they could breathe. my skin literally felt clogged. when i washed off my face at night i had 3 new and small pimples that appeared on my cheeks two on my chin and some red patches.thick consistency formula this product is super thick its not light weight or breathable at all especially if you apply it every 2 hours as intended for proper sun protection. after one application i noticed my face looked pretty nice and almost like i had a layer of foundation. by the second layer i looked like i had straight up cake face.doesnt play nice with hairline if you accidentally get this product on your eyebrows eyelashes because yes you need to apply sunscreen to your eyelids too near your hairline. good luck. i had white looking eyelashes the whole day and couldnt get it off my eyelashes because the formula is so thick. i dont wear mascara either so i couldnt cover it up. i looked very strange.tint lastly the universal tint was very off for my skin tone. which isnt a deal breaker because if this product worked i couldve always bought the mediumtan option from their new tints. if you have pink undertones this will work well for you. the undertones in this tint are very pink and because i have yellow undertones you could clearly see near my hairline and on my neck where the sunscreen startedstopped.if you read through all this wow you rock. haha. i hope its helpful for some. if you have non sensitive skin pink undertones and dont mind a thickfoundation looking sunscreen. this is probably for you i wish it worked for me. my holy grail and recommendation over this is supergoop mattescreen. its amazing and i have no negatives to say about that. but it is so so much more expensive. good luck on your sunscreen journey heavy  caused clogged pores acne

review: australian gold botanical sunscreen tinted face mineral lotion spf 50 is my holy grail sunscreen. as someone with sensitive skin and a love for the outdoors finding the perfect sunscreen has always been a challenge but this product has exceeded all my expectations.what sets australian gold apart is its lightweight formula and natural tint. it blends seamlessly into my skin leaving behind a subtle glow that enhances my complexion without feeling heavy or greasy. plus the tint provides light coverage perfect for days when i want to go makeupfree but still look put together.but beyond its cosmetic benefits australian gold offers unbeatable sun protection. with spf 50 and mineralbased ingredients i can trust that my skin is shielded from harmful uv rays even during long hours in the sun. and the fact that its reefsafe gives me peace of mind knowing im protecting both my skin and the environment.

review: okay so i like makeup that stays on. i dont want to touch up etc however most makeup like this is for oily skin and is very drying. i am 5 months pregnant which means i am more dry than the already dry i was just living in arizona. so how i make this work is i put the 2 aha paulas choice body lotion in the purple bottle on my face first then i use the snail mucin moisturizer thats recently been popular. then i use the lightest shade of this stuff all over my face and neck on top of that then i use the darkest shade of this sunscreen as my tanner. thennnnn it dries and i look like a wrinkly old lady because this stuff is drying. but the color is great and its not makeup so it makes me happy. then i have to no joke put the first aid kit moisturizer sold at sephora for cheap allll over the top of it. then i put under eye cream thickly under my eyes to keep hydrated then i top it off with the walmart glotion in the rose gold color. and thats how i achieve this skin protected but moisturized look in the photo with no real face makeup i did see the comment saying they just put a bunch of oil on their face before this sunscreen and ill try that monday to see if it works with less steps. overall tho its good sunscreen with a nice coverage once its dry and im never buying foundation or powder again. can work for dry skin

review: i was looking for a tinted moisturizer  mineral sunblock that was totally nontoxic and could serve as bb cream and this seemed to fit the bill.  i didnt pay attention to the waterresistant part. even though the sunblock is mineral rather than chemical to get this product waterresistant they have to add chemicals that are not so great. that was disappointing.i would not use this product if you were hoping to wear it under your makeup or to blend it with any other bb cream or foundation. it does not blend. it needs to be used alone or with only powder over.  even so it doesnt seem to absorb or blend into the skin perfectly although it is acceptable. if you put other makeup over it there will be swirls of product that just sit there and look ugly.  thats the trouble with water resistance.this product does not have a fragrance but its natural smell is somewhat noticeable though very mild and i would describe the smell as chalky or frostinglike.  i feel like i am smelling the waterresistant chemical. its not bothersome but its also not my favorite thing.if you are using this product by itself while it doesnt provide a lot of coverage it does a nice job of moisturizing and softening the face. it can provide a nice base for maybe a little concealer and powder. as far as i know it is sun protective though i havent really tested it for that. im sure the waterresistance would come in handy for your watersports in the summertime.all in all my major complaint is the fact that the words water resistant are so small on the bottle that i didnt notice. i only took one star away because this is about my preference and not necessarily anything wrong with the product. water resistant  not blendable  toxic

review: im a swim instructor and lifeguard at the ymca and i spend between 4 and 7 seven hours in the sun and pool 5 days a week. i also have incredibly sensitive skin some chemical sunscreens make me break out with rosacea cystic hormonal breakouts dryness and t zone oiliness so ive got a lot on my face thatim interested in covering up. many of the neutrogena sunscreens run into my eyes when i get in the pool to teach and they wash off after an hour and i burn badly. when i reapply it even after waiting 1520 min before getting my face wet to let it soak in it still runs into my eyes and i usually burn through many of them. this product doesnt run because its a very thick consistency and since its zinc and not a chemical sunscreen i dont break out as badly. usually zinc sunscreens leave a white cast but since this is tinted it doesnt leave the white cast and actually helps keep my skin tone even in the pool where i dont have the option of wearing concealer or something to cover my breakouts. its so thick that it stays on even if you rub your face with your hands and it does take a couple washes to fully remove from your face. one thing i will say this doesnt come in different shade options  there is one single shade and its very obviously designed for light to medium skin tones. a person with a medium to deep skin tone would probably not be able to wear this without a paleorange cast on the skin. im quite pale with lots of redness so when i use it it looks very tan on me because im a little too pale for the shade but once i rub it in it isnt as intense as it looks when you first see it out of the tube. it appears orange in some lighting but even on me once its properly rubbed in it isnt orange anymore. i started using this about 2 months ago. my skin has been difficult recently so i have been getting some new breakouts while using this product over the last two months however im fairly sure its because of hormones not the sunscreen.overall i would recommend this to anyone with light to medium skin tones who wants a thick powerful sunscreen that lasts and thats not chemical but without the white cast. longlasting no white cast good mineral formula no breakouts on sensitive skin.

review: i was very impressed with australian gold tinted sunscreen. i have sensitive skin and can rarely use chemical sunscreens because when they react with sunlight it causes a rash on my skin. ive tried many many different mineralbased sunblocks over the years and this is my favorite.it stays on strong even through heavy perspiration. i use it while gardening and hiking and it never runs. i havent burned yet. it is so persistent in fact that washing with soap and water still leaves quite a bit on my skin. i have no doubt it would stay on while swimming. but the remnants left on my face after washing dont bother me. after showering or washing my face i just use a cotton pad soaked in toner and its gone.another surprising attribute of this lotion is how well it matches my skin tone. i am of asian heritage and have always had trouble finding foundations or powders that dont make my face pink. this lotion does not stand out on my skin. it doesnt look unnaturally rosy like im wearing makeup or have a white kabuki mask on. my least favorite part of mineral sunscreens is how pasty white or even lavender they would appear on my skin. australian gold tinted doesnt have that problem at all for me.a final plus is that this lotion does not promote acne. i have used cetaphil oil control spf moisturizer and it caused me to breakout in little pimples all over my face.ive also used mineralbased spf bb creams such as physicians formula and while they dont irritate my skin or cause breakouts they tend not to stay in place when i sweat.this australian gold botanical face sunscreen behaves much more like a foundation than an ordinary sunscreen. its got a lightweight feel and matte finish that makes it very pleasant to wear. just beware it will stain white clothing and has not been easy to wash out.this is the best mineral sunscreen ive used yet. i only wish it were available in a larger bottle i would use it all over my body if it didnt cost so much.australian gold botanical sunscreen spf 50 mineral lotion 5 fl oz  4 stars. i also purchased the larger bottle of body mineral sunscreen. didnt like it as much. unlike the tinted face lotion it does leave a pale hue on my skin. however its not nearly as bad as neutrogena sensitive skin sunscreen. if the neutrogenas whiteness is a 10 australian gold body mineral sunscreen is about a 4. the color is kind of a faint whitishpink. at least its not thick white or purplish like some mineral sunblocks.a big plus from both these lotions from australian gold is they go on with a powdery nongreasy finish they dont feel heavy sticky or oily at all like many other sunscreens and they dont leave my hands slippery.also the body mineral lotion seems to be even more stubborn than the face sunscreen. after showering and despite using a pouf to scrub myself there were still white lines in the nooks and crevices of my skin. i definitely prefer the face mineral lotion from this brand. would give the body sunscreen 4 stars if i could review the two separately. stays on through sweat and even matches my skin tone

review: i found out about this sunscreen through angie from her hot and flashy youtube channel. she did a video earlier this year where she covered a bunch of different products to find her favorite face sunscreen. she did at least 20 high end and drugstore and this was her favorite so naturally i had to try it and she was right this is a great product especially for a barrier sunscreen. the barrier ingredients used in the us are inferior to the europe and asia so that makes them difficult to blend and often dry with a white cast. this product both blends well and does not dry my skin out. it is hydrating too which is great for my dry sensitive skin. the light shade is pretty light and there is a pretty big difference between that and the medium. so depending on the of the year i may use one or the other or do a blend of the two. i also love that i can wear this on its own if i dont feel like wearing makeup and it leaves just a hint of tinted coverage. since this is a hydrating sunscreen it does leave a dewy glow on its own. i would suggest still using a primer on top of it if you plan to wear foundation. i have repurchased this three times already so it has become a staple in my daily routine. great prod uct please dont discontinue it neutrogena my most favorite sunscreen

review: i love the tinted elta md but i cannot afford 3040 per bottle of sunscreen i just cant so ive been on the hunt for something else in a drugstore price that will suffice.i do not have sensitive skin in general but sunscreen regularly burns my face so i have to be super careful with what i use.im also on tretinoin so my skin is extra vulnerable to burning so i must wear sunscreen  on my face  ive always hated it in the past so didnt use it i regret that now.anyway  this stuff is legit. i like it aaaaaalmost as well as my tinted elta md samples at a fraction of the price. my skin is still semipurging and not totally clear so i love that it helps concealblur my skin imperfections. it makes it easier for me to skip foundation  my skin is protected and it conceals my ick lol.i have never burned with this sunscreen on either. i am active and spend a lot of time in the sun  working in the yard working out outside bootcamp style etc and zero burns.im only removing one star because it tends to transfer easily onto clothing etc and can be a bit of a pita to remove. i use micellar water as the first part of a double cleanse and that helps a lot.  also i know for some it makes them look a little orange thankfully i am fair but not ultra light skinned and it suits my skin tone well  i tend to have slight warm undertones and this just works well for me no oompa loompa orange hue for me thankfully. after 4 months of testing  this is my new holy grail

review: im a seasoned chemical sunscreens user. im in my early 40s and have been wearing some sort of sunscreen quasidaily since my early 20s. i can remember a time when good facial sunscreens were hard to get when i had to order products from spain or france and hope they made it through customs before amazon brought the world of skincare to us before the american cosmetic brands wised up to the fact that if they make better products well buy them. now we have a vast array of choices which is a great thing a sunscreen for everyone. no excuse to not protect ones self on a daily basis. i decided recently to make the switch to a more environmentally responsible reef safe sunscreen even though my husband loves to remind me that ive never been to a coral reef and the closest one is thousands of miles away weve all seen finding nemo all drains lead to the ocean. i tried this suncreen because the reviews were generally positive and i liked that it was a multitasker that could potentially even my skin tone. i absolutely love this sunscreen. i look forward to putting it on in the morning hugely important since it has to be applied to be effective. it feels creamy and rich but dries to a semimatte finish. the tone is just pigmented enough to help my rosaceaprone skin look less pink. and it comes in a fatfeeling three ounce tube for a great price. my only complaint for which i took off one star is that it feels a little heavy on my skin im conscious of rubbing my face against things like a scarf the hood of a jacket etc. it does transfer slightly and i dont like that. i havent used enough physical sunscreens to know if this is typical of them all or just an australian gold problem but i will repurchase this one anyway maybe i just need to apply less i use about a chickpea sized dollop and rub it in well.  the pluses outweigh the one minus and its not enough for me to waste money experimenting when im very happy with this one. possible hg material for me

review: i have always been hesitant to wear a daily sunscreen since my skin breaks out easily and tends to be oily but now that ive reached my early 30s i decided it was time to get serious about skin protection. i tried this product on a whim after reading some other positive reviews and i love this sunscreen for a multitude of reasons1 it provides great sun protection. i wore this on my face while on vacation in the caribbean and got zero sunburn on my face while my shoulders simultaneously burned to a crisp while wearing a different spf 30 lotion. it seems to be quite water resistant as well since my face did not burn even after id been in the water.2 it is absolutely not greasy in fact i feel that this sunscreen leaves my skin feeling less oily at the end of a long hot day. my skin feels smooth and looks matte after applying this product it is definitely not shiny and greasy like some sunscreens are3 the tint is very subtle and mostly fades to nothing after you apply it. before i began using the product i was worried about the color of the tint since it appears to be a pinkish tan while my skins undertone is a yellowish tan. ultimately i have not noticed any color mismatch between this product and my skin tone it does not leave you looking like youre wearing makeup or foundation.4 this product is advertised as being fragrancefree which it is i dont like scented products as they tend to give me a headache after a few hours and this products light lotion smell disappears once youve applied it.5 the only very minor critique i have with this product is that it does not hydrate my dry skin very well. when my cheeks were dry in the winter i had to also use my nonsunscreen moisturizer as this product left my areas of dry skin still looking dry.i have been very satisfied with this product and i would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a daily sunscreen that protects your skin and does not look greasy.
